 title : Samba 4 : Samba 4 - Open Hub
 title : The m-a-d-n-e-s-s Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>MADNESS provides a high-level environment for the solution of integral and differential equations in many dimensions using adaptive, fast methods with guaranteed precision based on multi-resolution analysis and novel separated representations. There are three main components to MADNESS.  At the lowest level is a new petascale parallel programming environment that increases programmer productivity and code performance/scalability while maintaining backward compatibility with current programming tools such as MPI and Global Arrays.  The numerical capabilities built upon the parallel tools provide a high-level environment for composing and solving numerical problems in many (1-6+) dimensions.  Finally, built upon the numerical tools are new applications with initial focus upon chemistry, atomic and molecular physics, material science, and nuclear structure. </p>

<p>Please look in the wiki for more information and project activity. </p>

<p>Getting the sourceAnonymous, read-only source checkout: </p>

<p>   svn  checkout  http://m-a-d-n-e-s-s.googlecode.com/svn/local/trunk  m-a-d-n-e-s-s-read-onlyDevelopers, please see the wiki Subversion page for instructions. </p>

<p>Underneath the hoodIf you would like a glimpse at what&#39;s going on under the hood have a look at this call graph generated using the Google perftools. It nicely shows how work is funneled through the task-queue and how about 50% of the time is spent in the optimized matrix routines.  The calculation computed the energy and gradient for di-nitrogen using the local density approximation on a two-core Thinkpad x61t.   </p>

<p>FundingThe developers gratefully acknowledge the support of the Department of Energy, Office of Science, Office of Basic Energy Sciences and Office of Advanced Scientific Computing Research, under contract DE-AC05-00OR22725 with Oak Ridge National Laboratory.   </p>

<p>The developers gratefully acknowledge the support of the National Science Foundation under grant 0509410 to the University of Tennessee in collaboration with The Ohio State University (P. Sadayappan).  The MADNESS parallel runtime and parallel tree-algorithms include concepts and software developed under this project. </p>

<p>The developers gratefully acknowledge the support of the National Science Foundation under grant NSF OCI-0904972 to the University of Tennessee.  The solid state physics and multiconfiguration SCF capabilities are being developed by this project. </p>

<p>The developers gratefully acknowledge the support of the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) under subcontract from Argonne National Laboratory as part of the High-Productivity Computer Systems (HPCS) language evaluation project.</p>

 title : The m2wtp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>NoticeUse q4e or m2eclipse instead. Now q4e and m2eclipse supports WTP directly. This project remains for history :) </p>

<p>Release History0.1.2 (2007/08/03) - Added to proper classpath entries according to build scopes 0.1.1 (2007/06/26) - Fixed to display the popup menu labels correctly 0.1.0 (2007/05/31) - First released IntroductionThis plugin provides the integration of m2eclipse and Eclipse WTP. </p>

<p>M2WTP has the same goal with LibCopy, but manages J2EE module dependency instead of links(virtual file). The followings are differences from LibCopy. </p>

<p>Adds maven artifacts as required J2EE modules instead of links. Imports from maven project model directly, so don&#39;t need Maven Classpath Container. Supports the dependency between maven projects in local workspace. Provides the different classpath types as build scopes. This plugin requires Eclipse WTP 1.5.x or higher, m2eclipse 0.0.11.20070603-1200. m2eclipse 0.0.11 is the current snapshot version, so it is also distributed to ensure the integrity between M2WTP and m2eclipse. m2eclipse distributed here is the exactly same with m2eclipse update-dev, but later versions than 0.0.11.20070603-1200 may not compatible with m2wtp. </p>

<p>M2WTP is not a mature project yet, but It will be more efficient with this plugin when using Eclipse WTP and m2eclipse. </p>

<p>Please use the issue tracker if you have anything to suggest or find a bug. </p>

<p>InstallRequirements : Eclipse WTP 1.5.x or 2.0.x, J2SE 5.0 or higher </p>

<p>Install : Use Update Manager M2WTP Update Site </p>

<p>UsageAdd Classpath Variable &quot;M2_REPO&quot; properly (maybe &quot;/.m2/repository&quot;) Remove &quot;Maven2 Dependencies&quot; Classpath Container from  Maven Web Project Right-click a Maven Web Project and Select &quot;Add M2WTP Builder&quot; modify pom.xml check J2EE Module Dependency in Project Properties and Web Library Classpath Container</p>

 title : The mac-soapclient Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>SOAP Client </p>

<p>SOAP Client uses WSDL files you provide to dynamically create a graphical user interface for any given SOAP-based web service. Here&#39;s how: </p>

<p>Find a SOAP-based web service that also has an accompanying WSDL description file. Launch SOAP Client 1.0 and paste the URL of a remote WSDL file into the &#39;WSDL&#39; text field, or download the WSDL file to your local system and find it using the &#39;Browse&#39; Button. Click the &#39;Parse&#39; button. Watch in wonder as SOAP Client dynamically builds a graphical user interface for the SOAP-based web service described by the given WSDL file. Use this newly-created UI to select your desired method and input your parameter values. SOAP Client will automatically take care of adding the Endpoint URI, method namespace, and SOAPAction headers. Click the &#39;Execute&#39; button. Now view both the SOAP request and response in the tabbed view below.</p>
 summary : <p>This project uses Gosu and Chipmunk and AMSTracker to demo using the mac accelerometer as a controller.</p>

 title : The macshark Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>MacShark - network toolbox for Mac OS XThis project aims to be a comprehensive network toolbox. Its features are to be </p>

<p>lightweight (compared to other tools) secure (only one small executable to be setuid to execute as root) be Mac OS X style (using Objective-C and Cocoa programming and GUI) </p>

<p>features </p>

<p>sniffer nmap frontend (require nmap as setuid root, see below) dig whois </p>

<p>installation </p>

<p>unzip run executable, first time you try to sniff you will be asked for your administrator password </p>

<p>nmap setup </p>

<p>install nmap in your PATH set the nmap binary as setuid : chown root /usr/local/bin/nmap chmod 4755 /usr/local/bin/nmap</p>
 title : The macwidgets Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Help OutIf you&#39;d like to support this project you can do so by donating: </p>

<p> </p>

<p>What are &quot;Mac Widgets for Java&quot;?Mac Widgets for Java are a collection of widgets seen in OS X applications, offered in a Java API. These widgets help Java developers create more Mac-like applications. Their usage is not restricted to Mac though, as they will render across platforms. </p>

<p>Guiding Design PrincipleMac Widgets for Java have been designed as components - so you won&#39;t see much inheritance. Component style designs help make the API simple and understandable. This stye of design also makes it easy for developers to use the components as they were intended to be used. </p>

<p>Problems or Questions?Feel free to email me at kenneth.orr@gmail.com</p>

 title : The magento-openerp-smile-synchro Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Welcome to the OpenERP / Magento connector project!</p>

<p>      </p>

<p> </p>

<p>News</p>

<p> </p>

<p>What is it for?Want to sell your OpenERP managed product catalog on the web with the professional and scalable e-commerce Magento platform? Want to add a multi-stock, production (MRP), localized accounting or outstanding CRM to your e-commerce store, want to back it with an incredibly powerful ERP? Then that synchronization module is for you. </p>

<p>Warning:Both Magento and OpenERP are complex open source products. Make sure you master them correctly independently before attempting any synchronization. </p>

<p>Design principles of the module:The main module of the connector comes as an OpenERP plugin that keeps most of the business rules and settings on the powerful and extensible OpenERP platform. Magento is mostly used to for customers to enter their sale orders. </p>

<p>Still, as Magento has a rather sophisticated promotion and package management, one can use Magento to deal with the exact pricing rules (including shipping and taxes), the sale order is passed back to OpenERP with those Magento prices, no matter what was the original OpenERP pricing (Magento can override OpenERP prices). Taxes and discounts are properly handled. </p>

<p>Main featuresProduct catalog export from OpenERP to Magento (with common atributes but without pictures at the moment, that&#39;s our next wanted feature) Product stocks updates, based on OpenERP virtual stocks (number of products in the physical stock that have not been reserved yet) Category tree export, including creation and updates. Each Magento store has its own root category id, you can thus choose to where Magento store products get loaded. Taxes sync (provided that you first manually set up the magento ids of the OpenERP taxes see UserManual) Sale orders imports from Magento to OpenERP. Only new sale orders are imported. This process find out which customers are already in the OpenERP database or if they have a new shipping or delivery address. Only new resources are created. Sale order lines are created too. Discounts and taxes amounts are properly imported for each line so you can finally generate an invoice in OpenERP or trigger procurement, shipping or manufacturing operations according to you stocks levels. Broken sale order re-import function: if for whatever reason some sale order can&#39;t be imported; for instance because it is referencing a product that is not known inside the OpenERP database (which would just be an administration error), then once you fixed the missing product, this button gives you the opportunity to re-import properly those sale orders that failed previously. Minimal code and best practices coding so evolving and maintaining the code is a snap: very minimal extra OpenERP data structures and views. No extra Magento data structure nor extra view.    </p>

<p>DocumentationSee our flash demos here UserManual FAQ FeedbackYour feedback will be very appreciated, use the following links: </p>

<p>Bug tracker discussion group </p>

<p>SupportAll the code here is free and open source. Still, you can also get paid support, by contacting us at Smile.fr.</p>

 title : The mail-queue Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Sending email can be a bottleneck in your Rails app.  Here&#39;s a dead simple way of making all your mail be delivered asynchronously. </p>

<p>With the plugin installed, all mail send from Mailer gets put into a table called QueuedMails.  Here&#39;s my migration to add that table:  </p>

<p>class AddQueuedMailTable &lt; ActiveRecord::Migration
<br/>  def self.up
<br/>    create_table :queued_mails do |t|
<br/>      t.column :object,     :text
<br/>      t.column :mailer,     :string
<br/>    end
<br/>  end</p>

<p>  def self.down
<br/>    drop_table :queued_mails
<br/>  end
<br/>endNow everytime you call  </p>

<p>YouMailer.deliver_something(*params)that mail object will be stored in the QueuedMails table.  Just periodically call script/runner from a cron job to process your new mail queue:  </p>

<p>&quot;script/runner &#39;MailQueue.process&#39; -e production&quot;If you want to bypass the queue just called the deliver_method_name with an exclamation point at the end.  Like:  </p>

<p>YouMailer.deliver_something!(*params)WARNING:  </p>

<p>This feature to bypass the queue isn&#39;t the same way it was done in the original release of this plugin, so it isn&#39;t backwards compatible. Not a huge thing to change, and it probably wasn&#39;t a very popular thing used by people using this plugin anyways.  </p>

<p>Nate, Inkling Inc., http://www.inklingmarkets.com</p>

 title : The mailapptoopml Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>If you use Mail.app, which is the default email application on Mac OS X, you will know that you can subscribe to RSS/Atom Feeds. This is all well and good, except when you come to exporting those feeds if you&#39;d like to start reading your feeds through another feed reader (such as OpenLink Data Space Feed Manager, Google Reader or NetNewsWire). </p>

<p>MailAppToOPML is a small script which turns Apple Mail.app&#39;s proprietary newsfeed subscription format into OPML. Allowing you to import all of your feeds into another system! </p>

<p>It is made for Mail.app on Mac OS X 10.5, it has not been tested on previous versions. It&#39;s developed entirely in the Ruby Programming Language (note... not Ruby on Rails... Ruby != RoR) </p>

<p>This project was developed by me, Daniel Lewis. It&#39;s my own project, fully public under an Open Source License called LGPL (meaning, practically, you can use it however you like... I don&#39;t mind).</p>
 title : The mailreminder Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OverviewA simple notes/tasks reminder. A task is submitted by an e-mail, reminder arrives in an e-mail. Written in Ruby, this server is hidden behind regular mail server. In the part receiving messages works similar to Remember The Milk </p>

<p>ComponentsSystem has two main components: </p>

<p>SMTP server - submits reveiver scheduler - remind sender </p>

<p>ServerServer listens on localhost:1234 receiving e-mail messages from regular, hardened SMTP server (postfix in my case). After receiving the mail is parsed to obtain all recognized data and stored in database (SQLite3). </p>

<p>SchedulerScheduler scans database seeking current minute and after gathering matching tasks sends reminders. </p>

<p>Additional infoLicenseIts licensed on GPLv2 and exactly this version. Someday it will be worth of downloading ;-) </p>

<p>Risk of usageYou use it at your own risk. No warranty of anything is given.</p>

 title : The makesimple Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The maketea Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Given a grammar in an extended BNF format, maketea will generate a C++ class hierarchy to store the abstract tree for that grammar, with support for deep (recursive) cloning, deep equality, and tree pattern matching (including wildcards). </p>

<p>In addition it generates explicit support for the visitor design pattern in the form of a visitor API, which makes it easy to define traversals over the AST. Visitors can include &#39;generic&#39; methods (for example, do such-and-such for every &#39;expression&#39;), but cannot transform the tree structure.  </p>

<p>Finally, maketea generates a transformation API which makes it easy to define tree transformations. An important property of the transformation API is that it uses the C++ type system to make it impossible to write tree transformations that violate the tree structure as dictated by the grammar. </p>

<p>Both the visitor and transformation APIs are set up in such a way to make their behavior completely configurable.</p>

 title : The makotos Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>(english translation below) </p>

<p>Mala DiretaO objetivo aqui é criar uma ferramenta simples de usar e ao mesmo tempo poderosa para o envio de e-mails em lote. </p>

<p>Por enquanto, o desenho está pronto e estou criando a primeira implementação - que está em pré-alpha. </p>

<p>Este projeto foi criado como muitos outros projetos open-source: para atender às necessidades do desenvolvedor, que quis disponibilizar para o mundo a solução, e quem sabe receber ajuda e o projeto deslanchar. De qualquer forma, também está sendo um meio para eu estudar algumas coisas também. </p>

<p>O projeto é baseado no cakePHP, que torna MVC no PHP mamão com açúcar! A idéia é também colocar umas perfumarias em AJAX, para tornar o uso agradável. </p>

<p>Saiba mais no wiki! </p>

<p>Mala Direta (English)Mala Direta is a portuguese expresion which mains &quot;mailing list&quot;. </p>

<p>Our goal is to create an easy-to-use while powerful web-based open source mass mailing application. </p>

<p>Right now, there&#39;s just plans and a litle bit of working things, and the development is pretty active. So I consider this pre-alpha for now. </p>

<p>This project, like many other free software projects, was created to solve a developer&#39;s problem. Then the developer wants to share his solution, and hopes to help someone, and get some help for the project to grow. </p>

<p>This application is build on cakePHP, which makes MVC programming to PHP a actual piece of cake! We&#39;ll put some eye-candy AJAX stuff to improve user&#39;s experience. </p>

<p>Read more on the wiki!</p>

 title : The mallory Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Mallory - Mathematics ActionScript Library - Advanced Math for ActionScript 3.0This is a library for doing advanced college level math (i.e. beyond calculus) with in ActionScript 3.0. </p>

<p>PartsThis library includes classes for working with  </p>

<p>Complex numbers  Permutations  Cycles Sets Algebraic structures(i.e. groups, rings, fields, etc.) Matrices (over algebraic structures) Numeric sequences Expression evaluation Vectors Polygons Statistical Analysis Graphing </p>

<p>Current StatusThere are some sample programs made with Mallory here. </p>

<p>On January 8th, I released an major update. Unfortunately, I haven&#39;t tested it very much so I know that it&#39;s full of bugs.  </p>

<p>I&#39;ve improved the organization of the code somewhat, but it still needs a lot of work. I know specifically that the ComplexMath class has many comments that are completely wrong. I copied and modified the code from the RealMath, and forgot to change all of the comments. </p>

<p>This latest update includes &quot;Quickulator&quot;, a sample application that uses the Mallory code base. </p>

<p>If anyone wants to help I, I could really use people to help me to test, debug, and comment the code. Any other ideas are also welcome. </p>

<p>HistoryMain Actionscript ProjectI&#39;ve been working on this project on and off since 2004. Since then, it&#39;s gone through numerous rewrites including transitions from actionscript to actionscript 2 and actionscript 2 to actionscript 3. Most of the ground work is done. There are some noticeable problems with the matrix (with decomposition) class and the expression evaluation class, but hopefully I&#39;ll solve those soon.  </p>

<p>Secondary Javascript ProjectThere is a very incomplete javascript implementation (MalloryJS) that I threw together one weekend, but I&#39;m not sure how much effort I want to put into it as ActionScript has a lot of features not found in JavaScript. Perhaps I&#39;ll put this on hold until JavaScript 2 becomes a widely accepted standard. </p>

<p>Future PlansIn the near future, I plan to implement the following features </p>

<p>Example usage Improved commenting Unit tests Equation solving Polynomial manipulation Numeric/symbolic integration and differentiation Conic Sections</p>

 title : The managed-sqlite Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Looking for developers!  Please email me!About this projectManagedSQLite is a managed implementation of the public domain relational database SQLite.   </p>

<p>Currently, ManagedSQLite works with Microsoft Visual C# 2005, Microsoft Visual Basic 2005 and Microsoft Visual C++ 2005. </p>

<p>Unlike other managed wrappers for SQLite, ManagedSQLite only requires its own DLL with no need for the SQLite DLL file - reducing the risk of DLL Hell. </p>

<p>Current version1.0.0.01340 (SQLite 3.4.0 with FTS1 and FTS2) </p>

<p>Download here: http://managed-sqlite.googlecode.com/svn/branches/bin/1.0.0.1340/ManagedSQLite.zip</p>

 title : The manageditk Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ManagedITK generates wrappers for .NET languages around ITK (The Insight Toolkit). </p>

<p>These wrappers can be used with any CLR language, including: </p>

<p>C# VB.NET C++/CLI IronPython Chrome and others. </p>

<p>ManagedITK is useful for a number of reasons, but mainly for the ability to rapidly create image processing applications with graphical user interfaces using Windows Forms (also known as System.Windows.Forms). </p>

<p>For wrapping of other languages (such as python and Java) please see WrapITK. </p>

<p>In short: ManagedITK makes (medical) image processing in C# easy!</p>

 title : The mangobot Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Mangos IRC Bot is an IRC (Internet Relay Chat) bot written in the Java programming language that is designed to be used along with a working MaNGOS server. I started writing it as a small personal project and it has grown big enough that I believe that it has the potential to benefit other users. It has two main parts to it. One is that it can perform regular status checks on a number of different hosts and display the results either by updating the topic or messaging users. <br/>10. Remove bans from account

<br/>15. Restart Realm when Mangos crashes
<br/>16. Show console output - use the GUI tab as a console so no need to run multiple programs and switch between them to send custom commands

 title : The manualgc Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This garbage collector uses a mark-sweep algorithm . Unlike BDW conservative garbage collector , it doesn&#39;t guess the pointer . So you should link the objects (memory block) manually by call gc_link . Namely , you should tell the collector that a memory block&#39;s life time depends on the correlative one&#39;s . </p>

<p>On the other hand, you should give the scope of temporary variable on the stack manually.  It will be easy if you call gc_enter at the first line of the function, and call gc_leave at the last line. btw, you don&#39;t need to call gc_enter / gc_leave every time. For example, you can only call gc_enter before your main loop and call gc_leave after the main loop returned. (It may waste some memory, but it works.)  </p>

<p>If you have done those correctly , gc_collect will be able to determine which memory block won&#39;t be accessed any longer, and then free them.  </p>

<p>ps. Another description here , if you can read Chinese.</p>

 title : The mapattributes Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Welcome to MapAttributes!MapAttributes enables thematic mapping and spatial analysis over the web.   </p>

<p>It can serve up geographic attributes in XML for use in web mapping or analysis.   It can ingest attribute data to automatically generate thematic maps or augment GIS databases. It supports input and editing of attribute data via the web.   </p>

<p>MapAttributes is an open source project that supports and extends the Geographic Linkage Service (GLS) standard from the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC).  It runs on any platform that supports Ruby on Rails.   </p>

<p>For more information, see the FAQ. </p>

<p>StatusMapAttributes is extremely new (like I just picked the name), but some functionality is already available.  See the RoadMap for a list of what is completed and yet to come. </p>

<p>Note: this project is being used to drive out improvements to the GLS standard, so it may extend or deviate from the published standard.   </p>

<p>ContributingNew coders and testers are very welcome.</p>

 title : The mapstouch Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This application lets you use panning and zooming with multi-touch in the Google Maps Flash API: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L0Fp_0TZojg </p>

<p>The first thing you need to do is to register your own Google Maps API key. Refer to the comment in GoogleMapsPureAS on how to choose the right url name to make sure you do not have ugly debug strings (like in the youtube video above) on your screen. </p>

<p>The second thing you need to do is to download the Google Maps for Flash API from here. You have to include the swc file from the folder lib of the uncompressed sdk.zip file either in your Flash GUI or put it into the libs folder of your Flex Builder project. </p>

<p>More details in the blog post about this project: Google Maps Multi-touch Actionscript Code </p>

<p>The Google Maps Flash API can be found here: http://code.google.com/apis/maps/documentation/flash/ </p>

<p>The code version of the touchlib&#39;s actionscript library can be found here: http://code.google.com/p/touchlib/source/browse/#svn/trunk/AS3%3Fstate%3Dclosed </p>

<p>The binary version of the touchlib can be found here: http://nuigroup.com/touchlib/. </p>

<p>For the touch signals TUIO is used from the nuigroup touchlib project: http://reactable.iua.upf.edu/pdfs/GW2005-KaltenBoverBencinaConstanza.pdf </p>

<p>Please beware that executing Google Maps on a local computer or in the intranet seems to be not committed according to Google’s license agreements. You should not use it for commercial purposes within a local installation.</p>

 summary : <p>Marajo 2.0Marajo 2 is the same powerful web application framework used by CloudRight LLC to provide fast scalable web applications to its clients.  title : The masapi Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Massive Loading APIThe target of the Masapi is to provide a complete framework dedicated to the management of the massive loading into a flash/flex application. It is designed to be as easy as possible to use but also to be as flexible as possible. </p>

<p>There are the main features that the framework supports : </p>

<p>Same interface for all load managers (URLLoader, Loader, ...) Easy massive loading classes Advanced massive loading (priority, dependencies) Advanced massive loading management (loading policy, loading information, ...) </p>

 title : The matrixdump Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>matrixdump is just a little PoC (and PoS) program i wrote in an evening to toy with ncurses and demo how you can drive a &quot;matrix&quot; like view using network data. i&#39;m surprised no one&#39;s done this before, but it&#39;s been on my mind since the original movie came out.  </p>

<p>matrixdump isn&#39;t as feature rich as tcpdump or tethereal, and the decodes are minimal. just the protocol, IPs, ports ... nothing else. the decodes could definitely be more interesting if you wanted to make them more usable. </p>

<p>amusingly, i&#39;m not a huge fan of the movies, they were ok but the sequels don&#39;t get me as turned on as the original.  </p>

<p>anyhow, why not drive some fun with a tool like this? part of this is me thinking about how to visualize CTF competitions, and part of it was me delving into the world of ncurses. </p>

<p>what&#39;s very funny is that this shows how lousy this interface is for actually looking at data. then again, you can say things like &quot;porn, porn, SYN flood, porn ...&quot; </p>

<p>matrixdump contains code from dugsong&#39;s dsniff (the pcaputil routines). </p>

<p>BUGSmatrixdump is just a toy, and isn&#39;t very feature filled or stable. </p>

<p>the scrolling is a bit wonky at times, but generall works. the color stuff is a bit wonky, set your term to &quot;ansi&quot; on some systems to get it to respect &quot;-c&quot;. </p>

<p>INSTALLATIONbuilt and tested on openbsd and OS X. it uses pcap, libdnet, and ncurses. you&#39;ll have to tweak a few things for other platforms probably.  </p>

<p>THANKSJean-Francois Brousseau, Ron Rosson, Gustavo, Michael Coulter, Joris Vink</p>

 summary : <p>My own private framework library..., </p>

 title : The maven-additions Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Welcome to maven-additions, a rag-tag collection of maven goodies. </p>

<p>July 17, 2008 </p>

<p>added basic-settings project to define JBoss Maven repo, Java SE 5 compiler and other general settings for a Maven project, download this first then run: mvn installadded seam-dependencies project to define all the Seam stuff you need in a Maven project, this project inherits from basic-settings so you&#39;ll want to download that first, then build this project:  mvn installadded seam-example, this is the project I used for the UJUG presentation on Thursday July 17, 2008.  Here is a link to the presentation.  Once you&#39;ve downloaded and installed basic-settings and seam-dependencies you&#39;ll be able to run this project.  To test the application ASAP, try using jetty like this: mvn jetty:runTo use this in Eclipse or NetBeans you&#39;ll need the appropriate Maven plugin.  IntelliJ 7.0 should just work with the project.</p>
 title : The maven-blazeds-spring-archetype Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Inspired by todolist application from http://www.adobe.com/devnet/flex/articles/fullstack_pt1.html. </p>

<p>I know there&#39;re some projects that&#39;re doing the same stuff. But some of stuff i can&#39;t find in them are: </p>

<p>Well integration with Eclipse and flex builder Allow debugging java code and flex code in Eclipse Support session timeout in flex app (undergoing) And this project I created aims to support those targets </p>

<p>In this project, I&#39;m using flex mojos plugin to compile Flex app. The generated code can be imported directly to Eclipse (tested with 3.3.1) with WTP support, required to have m2eclipse </p>

<p>Click here to get started </p>

<p>Click here to download sample application generated from the archetype </p>

<p>Change logs: </p>

<p>11 Mar 2009: Added instructions how to compile module-based Flex application here 17 Nov 2008: Finally I squeezed sometime and fixed some of the issues. Please check out the code and build, alternatively using the command mentioned on 27 Sep 2008 to get the latest archetype Updates: Fixed &amp;nbsp;issue 6&amp;nbsp; and &amp;nbsp;issue 8&amp;nbsp; Updated to flex-mojos 2.0M8 Added dependency in flex-mojo plugin section to resolve license if any Created service-config-local.xml used for Flex Builder compilation. Remember to keep sync with service-config.xml!!!! </p>

<p>27 Sep 2008: I created the archetype repository in google code svn repo, so now you guys can create the project template right away by issuing the command mvn archetype:generate -DartifactId= -DarchetypeCatalog=http://maven-blazeds-spring-archetype.googlecode.com/svn/maven2</p>

 summary : <p>g-bios OverviewThe g-bios project aims at designing and developing a general architecture of bootloader/BIOS for Android and generic embedded Linux. </p>

<p>FeaturesAuto-decting the type image file and auto-burning intelligently. </p>

<p>Various file system support, including YAFFS1, YAFFS2, JFFS2, CRAMFS, NFS, etc. </p>

<p>Tab completion and history saving support. </p>

<p>Flash parition support. </p>

<p>boot parameters (Linux command line) auto setting, which greatly reduces the booting complexity and error probability! </p>

<p>Seperated into two parts, top half and bottom half on which the NB (Never Burn Down) tech is based. </p>

<p>Good design of subsystems, including interrupt, flash, network, etc. </p>

<p>Video BIOS Integerated. </p>

<p>Kermit support </p>

<p>GUI-based configuration. </p>

<p>USB host/device support </p>

<p>MaxWit Linux OverviewMaxWit Linux is a free, open source, linux-based and fully customizable software platform, not only suitable for smart low-power embedded system, but also for high-performace PC. MaxWit Linux offers a full stack: a Linux kernel, native C/C++ libraries, Java VM and rich applications. </p>

<p>MaxWit Linux Architecture </p>

 title : The maze3dflyer Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>maze3dflyer is:An OpenGL graphics demo/game. It generates a random 3D maze with some configurable properties, and displays the maze using textured 3D graphics. You can &quot;fly&quot; through and around the maze using standard movement controls. </p>

<p>News2009/10/30: released v1.5.4 (minor feature release) added pictures on walls (just Mona Lisa for now) 2009/10/29: released v1.5.3 (minor feature release) fixed &amp;nbsp;issue #4&amp;nbsp;, problem with going forward and sideways at the same time 2009/10/23: released v1.5.2 (minor feature release) added keys to adjust key/mouse sensitivity 2009/10/23: released v1.5.1 (bug fix release) Full screen mode toggle now works (textures reload). 2009/06/12: released v1.5 Show maze as it&#39;s being generated (fun to watch). Blue = the queue of cells from which the maze is to expand. Red = cells that are marked &quot;forbidden&quot; for growth because they are too close to other passages. Rather than just finding the route from entrance to exit, you now need to collect all the white balls on the way. More challenging. See-through grates give some visibility in/out of maze. Many other tweaks. Let me know what you think!   </p>

<p>2008/10/16: released v1.1 Show solution route (toggle via &#39;R&#39; key) Using this on a level disallows recording a new best score on that level. Auto-forward (toggle via &#39;Q&#39; key) so you don&#39;t have to hold down &#39;W&#39;. Note that SHIFT still toggles slow &amp; fast modes, independently of &#39;Q&#39;. Some other refactoring and tweaks. 2008/10/16: created Wiki page FeatureWishlist. Please take a look and give your feedback on most desirable features. 
<br/>2008/07/20: first major release (v1.0), with the features listed below    </p>

<p>PlatformIn the initial release, the project is developed for Windows / Visual C++. A Linux port is planned. </p>

<p>Featuresrandom 3D maze generation, with sparseness constraint textured 3D maze rendering keyboard-controlled navigation (&quot;flying&quot;) around and through maze collision detection prevents flying through maze walls code demonstrates use of quaternions for rotation entrance and exit marked display FPS and help text maze solution timer and high score list nice skybox Planned featuresport to Linux make into screensaver (for windows and xscreensaver) autopilot to fly through maze objects in maze skyboxes made from Stellarium landscapes provide run-time control of settings many other ideas; see ideas-todos.txt Screenshot</p>

 summary : <p>I have stopped the development of this plugin until further notice. This plugin hasn&#39;t been tested with Wordpress 2.7 so I am not sure how it behaves with that release. </p>

 summary : <p>DescriptionProvides automated conversion of MS Access 2000 databases to SQLite on any platform, utilizing   Jackcess and SQLite Java libraries. No native driver required. </p>

<p>MDB-SQLite is used by Plausible Labs to read government-supplied Access databases. </p>

<p>UsageTo compile, run: </p>

<p>ant dist </p>

<p>This will create a standalone jar in dist/mdb-sqlite.jar </p>

<p>To convert a database file: </p>

<p>java -jar dist/mdb-sqlite.jar source.mdb output.sqlite </p>

<p>Changes1.0.2 Release- Prefix index names with the table names to prevent name conflicts when converting indixes. </p>

<p>1.0.1 Release- Work-around around the SQLite JDBC drivers lack of support for boolean values (&amp;nbsp;Issue #2&amp;nbsp;) </p>

<p>- Add support for converting indexes (&amp;nbsp;Issue #3&amp;nbsp;)  </p>

<p>1.0 Release- Initial Release</p>

 title : The me2day-api Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>http://me2day.net/ API wrapper for various programming language. It provides API set to create a new post/comment and fetch other useful information.  </p>

<p>First release includes Java (1.5 or greater) and ActionScript 3.0. Let&#39;s try as the following java code!  </p>

<p>Post post = new Post();
<br/>post.setBody(&quot;Hey, check this pics&quot;);
<br/>post.setIconIndex(Post.ICON_THINK);
<br/>post.setTags(&quot;me2photo blah&quot;);</p>

<p>VirtualFile file = VirtualFile.create(new File(&quot;oops.png&quot;));
<br/>file.setProgressListener( new ProgressListener() { 
<br/>  @Override public void transferProgress(ProgressEvent e) { 
<br/>    System.out.println( String.format(&quot;%d / %d&quot;, e.getTransferredBytes(), e.getTotalBytes()) );
<br/>  }});
<br/>post.setAttachment( file );</p>

<p>Me2API me2 = new Me2API()
<br/>me2.setUsername(&quot;rath&quot;)
<br/>me2.setUserKey(&quot;00112233&quot;)
<br/>me2.setApplicationKey(&quot;1&quot;)
<br/>me2.post(post);me2day api for python 0.1simplejson에 의존성이 있습니다. Python 2.6을 사용하시는 분은 me2day.py 상단의 import simplejson 구문을 import json으로 변경하여 의존성을 없앨 수 있습니다. from me2day import me2API</p>

<p>#api = me2API(&#39;_username_&#39;, &#39;_userkey_&#39;, &#39;_application_key_&#39;) 
<br/>api = me2API(&#39;rath&#39;)
<br/>for f in api.get_friends():
<br/>  print &quot;%s(%s)&quot; % (f.id, f.nickname)</p>

<p>#api.create_comment({&#39;post_id&#39;: &#39;p2mjxx&#39;, &#39;body&#39;: &#39;just for test&#39;})</p>

<p>for p in api.get_posts({&#39;scope&#39;: &#39;friend[close]&#39;, &#39;count&#39;: 20}):
<br/>  print p.id + &quot;, &quot; + p.author.nickname + &quot;: &quot; + p.body_as_text </p>

<p>  for metoo in api.get_metoos({&#39;post_id&#39;: p.id}):
<br/>    person, date = metoo
<br/>    print date + &quot;, &quot; + person.nickname</p>

<p>  for comment in api.get_comments({&#39;post_id&#39;: p.id}):
<br/>    print &quot;  %s, %s: %s&quot; % (comment.id, comment.author.nickname, comment.body)</p>

<p>  api.noop()me2day api for java 0.6IMPORTANT 패키지 이름이 net.me2day.java에서 net.me2day로 변경되었습니다. 기존 매쉬업 개발자들은 소스코드를 수정해주셔야 합니다. Comment, Icon, Metoo, Person, Post, TrackComment 클래스가 entity 패키지로 이동되었습니다. net.me2day.entity.Comment 이런식입니다. 위의 Entity 클래스들을 GWT 환경에서 사용할 수 있도록 GWT Module 파일이 추가되고 net.me2day.gwt.client 패키지에 GWT 호환 entity 클래스들이 추가되었습니다. Me2API로 생성한 entity 클래스들을 GWT 호환 클래스로 변경하려면 기존 entity 클래스에 toGWT() 인터페이스를 통해 GWT 호환 오브젝트로 clone 할 수 있습니다. 각 entity 클래스들은 GWTFriendly 라는 인터페이스를 구현하게 되었으며 이 인터페이스에는 toGWT()만이 존재합니다.  GWT 에서 사용할 수 있도록 jar 파일에 entity 클래스들의 소스코드가 포함되도록 Ant Build 파일이 변경되었습니다.  me2day api for java 0.5Me2API.post에서 150자 체크시 Textile link를 길이 체크에서 제외하도록 변경함 (thanks to 꼬룸) 파일 첨부 지원 (thanks to 꼬룸) Post 클래스에 위도/경도를 지정할 수 있도록 변경됨. (thanks to 꼬룸) me2day api for java 0.4Me2API.KIND_XXX 시리즈 필드가 제거되었음. Me2API.ICON_XXX 시리즈로 교체 필요. 2008.07.07일 기준, http://codian.springnote.com/pages/89009 에 명시된 api 모두 구현. track_comments 구현. Me2API.getCommentsByMe 와 Me2API.getCommentsToMe Me2API.metoo 추가 Me2API.getMetoos 추가 Me2API.deleteComment 추가 상위 메서드 구현을 위해 TrackComment 와 Metoo 클래스 추가 me2api application-key 발급을 위해 Me2API.setApplicationKey 의 method-doc 수정. 프리미엄 제휴 파트너의 create_post 지원을 위해 Me2API.post 메서드 파라미터에 Map 추가. (icon_url, callback_url, content_type 등 지정 가능)</p>
 summary : <p>A 3d globe with wms tile support and arc-ball based rotation. </p>

<p>There are three targets for this source code 1) flash 2) opengl 3) iphone native app. </p>

<p>1) Flash is a challenging target.  Historically it has been somewhat difficult to show a 3d globe in the browser let alone anything in 3d; solutions such as java applets are not universally supported, and flash itself although well supported has had no 3d support.  Papervision3d is a lightweight pure source code flash component that we leverage to make it possible to easily deliver a 3d globe in the browser.  This is hopefully a foundation for variety of projects, and being open source it can hopefully be improved by the community. </p>

<p>Here is a running example of an earlier rev of the flash version of this code: </p>

<p>http://hook.org/anselm/projects/20070901_MeadanGlobe/globe/bin/globe.html 
<br/>2) The OpenGL version is quite simple and a good development reference point although of course not competitive with NASA WorldWind or Google Earth.  There is a sample port of the same code to cygwin under windows under opengl as well in /opengl . </p>

<p>3) The iPhone version is more preliminary - the hope is to improve it with community support.  I&#39;ve built an installer so you can install it via community sources like any app.  To do this you first crack your phone (ziphone.org) then goto your installer, and goto sources within that, and then add a new source - that new source will be http://meadanglobe.googlecode.com/files/iphone.xml.  When typing in the iphone ui it will try to capitalize iPhone.XML - reject that suggestion.  Now you will have the globe as a source.  Goto your installer main menu.  Goto Multimedia.  Goto Globe.  Install that.  Now it will appear as an icon on your iphone desktop.  Congradulations.  All you can do right now is rotate it.  It does not fetch textures dynamically.  The sun position is static right now.  Please feel free to help out.  For the source code see /iphone.  This runs on the OpenGLES profile.   An executable is included. </p>

<p>Here is a screen-shot of the iphone opengl native version: </p>

<p>http://www.flickr.com/photos/anselmhook/1747152617/in/set-72157602696188420/</p>

 title : The mechasimulator Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Mecha SimulatorThe goal to this project is to be able to build objects (ultimately robots or any mechanic device) in a simulated 3D physic world, then to be able to control them with a joystick. </p>

<p>Programming language is Ruby. </p>

<p>Screenshots </p>

<p># define a necklace:
<br/>object
<br/>  20.times do |i|
<br/>    p(0,0.1+i*0.1,2)
<br/>    string :last_two # do nothing if no two last elements
<br/>  end
<br/>  fix   :first
<br/>end_object</p>

<p>gravity :allresult: </p>

<p> </p>

<p># a box fixed by 2 points
<br/>object
<br/>  p(0,0,2)
<br/>  p(1,0,2)
<br/>  p(1,2,2)
<br/>  p(0,2,2)</p>

<p>  fix p(0,0,2.5)
<br/>  fix p(1,0,2.5)
<br/>  p(1,2,2.5)
<br/>  p(0,2,2.5)</p>

<p>  string 0,4
<br/>  string 1,5
<br/>  string 2,6
<br/>  string 3,7</p>

<p>  string 0,1
<br/>  string 1,2
<br/>  string 2,3
<br/>  string 3,0</p>

<p>  string 4,5
<br/>  string 5,6
<br/>  string 6,7
<br/>  string 7,4</p>

<p>  string 0,6
<br/>  string 1,7
<br/>  string 2,4
<br/>  string 3,5
<br/>end_object</p>

<p>boundary :all, :z, :&gt;, 0
<br/>gravity  :allresult: </p>

<p> </p>

<p>InstallationThis is a really simple list of steps, if you need detailled explanation, just contact me (see below). </p>

<p>install Ruby sudo apt-get install ruby1.8 install rubygems install ruby-opengl then </p>

<p>svn checkout http://mechasimulator.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ mechasimulator run &#39;ruby main.rb&#39; in the mechasimulator folder </p>

<p>define objects in the objects.rb file </p>

<p>Contactfaivrem at gmail dot com (also on gtalk)</p>

 title : The mecheye-fusion Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Mecheye Fusion, the latest project from Mecheye Labs, is an ActionScript 3.0 codebase that allows SWF files to be built in the Flash Player at runtime. All SWFs built from fusion should follow standard spec. </p>

<p>This project is currently in ALPHA state, and may or may not achieve other status. However, it is completely usable, and demos are fully-functional. </p>

<p>All work is licensed under the Mozilla Public License version 1.1, usable for commercial projects with attribution. </p>

<p>ABC and AVM2 assemblers are currently in the works, and this is our main focus of interest now. Some code from the ABC and AVM2 assemblers is from the Open Source Flex SDK and the Mozilla Tamarin project. </p>

<p>Mecheye Fusion is part of our work-in-progress RIA, which allows for completely online game development. </p>

<p>Development on Mecheye Fusion is done by JP St. Pierre, Josh Lory, and Drew. </p>

<p>We would love to have contributors! Help out!</p>

 title : The meetingbrowser Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Archives of meeting recordings are useful to check or to retrieve information from past meetings. However, such archives are usable only if appropriate tools, generally named meeting browsers, are available to locate the information that is searched for. One approach to meeting browsing is to design general-purpose browsers that help human users to locate relevant information, but another possibility is to design browsers that locate information automatically, for instance for verification (fact checking) purposes. The goal of this project is to design such an automatic browser, and to assess its performance on a set of pairs of true-false statements, which have been initially used to evaluate human-directed browsers. In other words, the goal is to design and to implement a system that determines the true and the false statement in each pair, to evaluate its performance over a set of several hundreds such pairs (for 4 recorded meetings), and to compare it with human subjects using existing meeting browsers. A comparative analysis of the system and the human scores on specific questions should indicate whether or not system and humans have the same difficulties answering such questions. This work will thus provide a baseline score against which humandirected browsers must be compared, to demonstrate significant improvement over a fully automated tool.</p>
 summary : <p>bug tracker</p>

 title : The meloneehr Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is a small project which uses a PageAdapter to store the current pages viewstate and controlstate in memcached in order to reduce network traffic to and from the client, and to reduce the risk of any tampering. </p>

<p>The project should be frictionless and can be applied to a compiled ASP .NET app by configuring the site. </p>

<p>To use this you need to do a few things: 1. Add BeITMemcached configuration to your web.config. Look at the beitmemcached project (http://code.google.com/p/beitmemcached/) for more info on how to configure this.  The minimum required is to merge the following into web.config. </p>

<p> 
<br/> 
<br/> 
<br/> 
<br/> 
<br/> 
<br/>2. Add MemcachedViewStatePageAdapter.browser from the test project to your App_Browsers folder 3. Copy BeITMemcached.exe and MemcachedViewStatePageAdapter.dll to your bin folder. </p>

<p>The viewstate for each page should now just contain the key used to retreive the ViewState from memcached. The ViewStates should expire after 48 hours.</p>

<p>how to i18nchange 
<br/>  &quot;English string&quot; 
<br/>to _(&quot;English string&quot;)ex1. basic flash[:notice] = &quot;Your article was saved&quot;
<br/>to
<br/> flash[:notice] = _(&quot;Your article was saved&quot;)ex2. width paramsget text could not use #{} syntax  </p>

<p> page.flash.errors &quot;Cannot remove system template &#39;#{params[:filename]}&#39;&quot;
<br/>to
<br/> page.flash.errors _(&quot;Cannot remove system template &#39;%{filename}&#39;&quot;) % {:filename =&gt; params[:filename]}ex3. view static html  Site Admin
<br/>to
<br/>  update po&gt;rake updatepo </p>

<p>make mo&gt;rake makemo</p>
 title : The mephistoshareitplugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Mephisto Share It </p>

<p>Author:  	William Wong Garay Blog:    	http://www.willywg.com E-Mail:  	willywg@gmail.com Support: 	http://www.willywg.com/2007/3/25/mephisto-share-it-plugin (Documentation in English and Spanish) Testing in: Mephisto 1.0 </p>

<p>&gt;&gt;What is this?&lt;&lt; </p>

<p>Mephisto Share It is a plugin that provides an unobtrusive way for your visitors to add your post to various social bookmarking sites. </p>

<p>&gt;&gt;Installation&lt;&lt; </p>

<p>1. Download the plugin archive from http://www.willywg.com/2007/3/25/mephisto-share-it-plugin. </p>

<p>2. Unrar the file mephisto_share_it.rar and put the &#39;mephisto_share_it&#39; folder into your vendor/plugins/ directory. Afterward, you should have a folder structure like this: vendor/plugins/mephisto_share_it/(a bunch of files). </p>

<p>3. Finally restart your application of mephisto. </p>

<p>&gt;&gt;Using&lt;&lt; </p>

<p>1. Personalizing. Open the mephisto_share_it.rb file in your vendor/plugins/mephisto_share_it/lib/ directory and change this data: </p>

<p>HOST = &#39;http://www.willywg.com&#39; #A. Change it for your  website 
<br/>. Activate the markers to use assigning them the true value and disable them with false nternational Bookmarks  DELICIOUS = true 
<br/>DIGG = true 
<br/>TECHNORATI = true 
<br/>GOOGLE_BOOKMARKS = true 
<br/>YAHOO_MY_WEB = true 
<br/>MAGNOLIA = true 
<br/>ispanic Bookmarks MENEAME = false 
<br/>FLOREAME = false 
<br/>ENCHILAME = false 
<br/>WEBEAME = false 
<br/>2. Drawing. Do this in your layout (for default values): </p>

<p>{{ article | share_it }} </p>

<p>This will generate: </p>

<p>Share It: »del.icio.us »Digg »Technorati »Google Bookmarks »Yahoo My Web »Ma.gnolia </p>

<p>Or use: </p>

<p>{{ article | share_it: &#39;Share this post&#39;,&#39;&#39; }} </p>

<p>This will generate: </p>

<p>Share this post del.icio.us Digg Technorati Google Bookmarks Yahoo My Web Ma.gnolia </p>

<p>3. If you want to use the bookmarkers separately you can make it in the following way: </p>

<p>{{ article | link_to_delicious }} or {{ article | link_to_delicious: &#39;Bookmark this with del.icio.us&#39; }} </p>

<p>Same way with link_to_digg, link_to_technorati, link_to_google_bookmarks, link_to_yahoo_my_web, link_to_magnolia, link_to_meneame, link_to_floreame, link_to_enchilame and link_to_webeame </p>

<p>&gt;&gt;Adding a bookmarker&lt;&lt; </p>

<p>This is simple: </p>

<p>1. Add a bookmarker with the true value: </p>

<p>MY_BOOKMARKER = false </p>

<p>2. Create a function: </p>

<p>def link_to_my_bookmarker(article, text = nil) 
<br/>url = &#39;http://my_bookmarker.com/post?&#39; #the url of the bookmarker site 
<br/>url += &quot;url=#{HOST}#{article&#39;url&#39;}&amp;title=#{article&#39;title&#39;}&quot; #the values by get 
<br/>content_tag :a, text || &#39;My Bookmarker&#39;, :href =&gt; url, :target =&gt; &#39;blank&#39; #the tag A generated with the Bookmarker name  
<br/>end 
<br/>3. Adds the following line in the function share_it: </p>

<p>links += pre + link_to_my_bookmarker(article) + &#39; &#39; if MY_BOOKMARKER</p>
 title : The merb-geokit Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>merb_geokit
<br/>===========</p>

<p>A plugin for the Merb framework that provides the geokit rails plugin.
<br/>This is mostly just a port of the rails plugin to merb format.  You should
<br/>see the documentation on the geokit project for more instructions.</p>

<p>site: http://geokit.rubyforge.org/
<br/>rdoc: http://geokit.rubyforge.org/api/index.html</p>

<p>using with merb
<br/>===============</p>

<p>Install with
<br/># svn co http://merb-geokit.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ merb_geokit
<br/># cd merb_geokit
<br/># rake package
<br/># gem install pkg/merb_geokit-x.x.x.gem</p>

<p>Include it in Merb in your dependencies.rb file in the config dir
<br/>dependency &quot;merb_geokit&quot;</p>

<p>When you first startup merb it will copy a default geokit.rb file
<br/>to your config directory.  You should edit that file and add your API
<br/>keys to it.</p>

<p>geocoding
<br/>=========
<br/>This plugin comes with several geocoding interfaces.  You will need to sign
<br/>up for an API key for at least Google and Yahoo.</p>

<p>GeoKit::Geocoders::GoogleGeocoder.geocode(someaddress)
<br/>GeoKit::Geocoders::YahooGeocoder.geocode(someaddress)
<br/>GeoKit::Geocoders::UsGeocoder.geocode(someaddress)
<br/>GeoKit::Geocoders::CaGeocoder.geocode(someaddress)
<br/>GeoKit::Geocoders::IpGeocoder.geocode(someaddress)</p>

<p>eg:</p>

<p>&gt;&gt; address = &quot;1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW, Washington, DC&quot;
<br/>=&gt; &quot;1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW, Washington, DC&quot;
<br/>&gt;&gt; puts GeoKit::Geocoders::GoogleGeocoder.geocode(address).to_yaml
<br/>--- !ruby/object:GeoKit::GeoLoc 
<br/>city: Washington
<br/>country_code: US
<br/>full_address: 1600 Pennsylvania Ave NW, Washington, DC 20006, USA
<br/>lat: 38.898774
<br/>lng: -77.036655
<br/>precision: address
<br/>provider: google
<br/>state: DC
<br/>street_address: 1600 Pennsylvania Ave Nw
<br/>success: true
<br/>zip: &quot;20006&quot;
<br/>=&gt; nil</p>

<p>session/cookie location store
<br/>=============================</p>

<p>If you want to store the geocode location of the user in a session
<br/>or cookie, based on IP address, then add the following to the top of
<br/>the Application controller</p>

<p>before :store_ip_location</p>

<p>then you will have:</p>

<p>session[:geo_location]
<br/>cookies[:geo_location]</p>

<p>acts_as_mappable
<br/>================</p>

<p>Acts as mappable works with ActiveRecord objects and will allow you to
<br/>do work with locations.  This would take an address, city, and state
<br/>and automatically look it up and populate the database with the results
<br/>from the search, including the lat, lng, and zip.</p>

<p>class Location &lt; ActiveRecord::Base
<br/>  acts_as_mappable
<br/>  validate :validate_address, :ensure_unique_address</p>

<p>  private
<br/>  def validate_address
<br/>    address = &quot;#{self.address}, #{self.city}, #{self.state}&quot;
<br/>    geo=GeoKit::Geocoders::YahooGeocoder.geocode(address)
<br/>    unless geo.success &amp;&amp; geo.street_address
<br/>      errors.add(:address, &quot;Could not find address&quot;) 
<br/>    end
<br/>    if geo.success
<br/>      self.lat, self.lng, self.zip = geo.lat,geo.lng,geo.zip
<br/>      self.address, self.city, self.state = geo.street_address, geo.city, geo.state
<br/>    end
<br/>  end</p>

<p>  def ensure_unique_address
<br/>    unless Location.find_all_by_address_and_zip(self.address,self.zip).empty?
<br/>      errors.add(:address, &quot;has already been taken&quot;)
<br/>    end
<br/>  end</p>

<p>end</p>

<p>rake tasks
<br/>==========</p>

<p>This plugin also adds rake tasks.  You must supply the address as an
<br/>environmental variable.  </p>

<p>$ rake -T geo</p>

<p>rake geo:ip      # Lookup up the address of an IP
<br/>rake geo:google  # Look up an address on google
<br/>rake geo:yahoo   # Look up an address on yahoo
<br/>rake geo:us      # Look up an address on us_geocoder
<br/>rake geo:ca      # Look up an address on ca_geocoder
<br/>rake geo:multi   # Look up an address using the failover</p>

<p>For example:</p>

<p>rake geo:ip ADDR=&quot;72.14.207.99&quot;
<br/>rake geo:google ADDR=&quot;1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW, Washington, DC&quot;</p>

<p>TODO
<br/>====</p>

<p>Need to write some specs.
<br/>Would like to make it work with the Sequel ORM.
<br/>Anything else?</p>

 summary : <p>créer une fonction meval qui meta-evalue du code lisp passé en parametre , on doit traiter les mots clé, les fonctions méta-définies, ... avec des instructions de base de lisp . </p>

<p>on ne doit appeller &#39;eval&#39; que dans les cas ou on ne peut pas faire autrement (les if, ...). </p>

<p>pour l&#39;instant gère : </p>

<p>fonctions </p>

<p>(meval &#39;(defun xxx ...) ()) (meval &#39;(xxx ....) ()) </p>

<p>macros </p>

<p>(meval &#39;(and ...) (meval &#39;(or ...) </p>

<p>extentions </p>

<p>(meval &#39;(meval &#39;(meval &#39;(fibo 10) ()) ()) ()) </p>

 title : The metabus Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>O projetoO foco principal deste projeto é facilitar e tornar mais eficiente a pesquisa por informações relevantes, organizando os resultados obtidos de diversos buscadores em uma única interface e de simples utilização.  </p>

<p>Para isso, este projeto disponibiliza a gestão do cadastro das fontes de busca registradas pelos administradores da ferramenta em uma intuitiva interface web.  </p>

<p>O sistema é capaz de realizar buscas em qualquer outra aplicação web que já realize algum tipo de busca e retorne os dados no formato RSS. Se a resposta da busca não respeita este formato pode-se cadastrar um arquivo de parser que, por meio de expressões XPATH e transformações XSLT aplicadas a XHTML, transforme este resultado em RSS. </p>

<p>O manual de utilização apresenta maiores detalhes de como administrar e configurar as fontes de busca. </p>

<p>Para garantir robustez e eficiência, a obtenção das requisições das pesquisas são processadas paralelamente e os seus resultados salvos em um sistema de cache capaz de atualizar as pesquisas realizadas de acordo com o uso do metabuscador. O sistema é completamente escalável, pois permite a configuração de vários servidores para realizar as pesquisas. Veja em dicas de configuração como escalar e otimizar o Metabus. </p>

<p>Mais detalhes técnicos sobre o projeto também podem ser visto na wiki de tecnologias utilizadas e modelagem do sistema. Detalhes de instalação podem ser encontrados no manual de instalação. </p>

<p>Durante o desenvolvimento haverá uma instância do metabus instalada em: http://metabus.aquarela3.com.br </p>

<p>ColaboradoresInterlegisEste projeto iniciou-se com a necessidade do Programa Interlegis de permitir a realização de pesquisas centralizadas por informações descentralizadas, a fim de melhorar a comunicação e o fluxo de informação entre os legisladores e aumentar a eficiência e competência das Casas Legislativas. </p>

<p>O resultado final será utilizado no Portal Interlegis buscando informações administrativas, legais e técnicas nos diversos sistemas de informações das Casas Legislativas e do próprio programa Interlegis. </p>

<p>Os requisitos funcionais deste produto pode ser visto com mais detalhes no Termo de Referencia</p>

 title : The mevalseb Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Conceptually, MEWIT is conceived to be different from traditional work-flow based system which require the setting up of routing instructions and business rules before the system becomes functional. At the same time applications for collaboration such as Lotus Notes can be costly to implement and consume a lot of resources. These traditional applications also cannot easily cut across multiple organizations to deliver a particular service easily due to their rigid structure and licensing models. Users are added on Ad Hoc basis in a viral fashion using email as the main link. </p>

<p>Chief Executive Officers need to be able to identify key actions and cascade these actions down the chain of command to the last personnel in an effective manner without necessitating the deployment of systems that may take months or even years to complete. The CEO as well as the managers of the government need a tool to deploy actions, capture and monitor collected information down the task tree, gain feedback and take remedial actions before issues explode into problems with embarrassing consequences. As the task travels from person to person, information, such as documents and data is captured and accumulated in the MEWIT system allowing relevant personnel to access information in a timely manner. The goal here is to spend more time doing the work that needs to be done rather than looking for the things that one needs to work. </p>

<p>Traditional database driven approach requires complex programming due to it&#39;s highly structured approach. Creating this structure has always been a major challenge within the Malaysian Government. MEWIT is simple in it&#39;s deployment due to the unstructured, document centric way in which it is implemented. The routing engine is the human being itself from which the system learns over time. It has a web based, mobile based (coming soon) as well as a desktop client based component (coming soon). This draws on social networking for workflows. </p>

<p>It is entirely built with a highly modular concept on Open Standards to allow the best fit of technological tools required for a particular requirement. All tools such as content intelligence, Statistical analysis, heuristics and the like can plug into the main open source component of the MEW using open JAVA based APIs. </p>

<p>At the same time, a complementary rather than a displacement approach to existing systems. As the system tracks and documents the flow, modelling of the complete system can take place based on actual work being done. This is an evolutionary based approach that allows a greater chance of success in building large scale systems. </p>

<p>Furthermore, metrics gathered on used of the system can be used for the the measurement and tracking of HR resources, identifying areas of over and under utilization as well as a more accurate assessment of civil servants performance for the purposes of appraisal and counselling. </p>

<p>  </p>

<p>MEWIT is comprised of several components. It is partly based on open source licensing for generic components such as it&#39;s client and some server based components as well as a proprietary secret sauce to glue the high end value added services together. For propagation purposes to promote ubiquity the basic client is a freely down loadable JNLP type application that communicates via normal smtp protocol to deliver the task items as an e-mail attachment. This client is similar in functionality to many PIM applications such as Lotus Agenda, Zoot, Outlook but is much easier to use and can integrate itself to the planned future premium services that allows collaboration, knowledge capture that traditional systems have not been able to achieve. Due to it&#39;s highly modular and open standards nature, deployments are at a speed of hours and days rather than months and years. These value added services exist in the network as a service and serves to orchestrate activities with many actors across many organizations in a seamless manner. </p>

<p>As an example are issues on Land which can involve Mine and Natural Resources, The State Governments and any number of parties and individuals who need to work on changes in legislation to achieve a purpose. At present this process is to complex and convoluted using paper trails that it takes years to achieve anything if at all (well, at least that is true here in Malaysia). Changing legislation is a nightmare What is there is tool that can cut across all boundaries and connect everything together within the context of a common goal.</p>

 title : The microblog-purple Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project implement a plug-in for any LibPurple base client like Pidgin or Finch . Currently it support Twitter, Identica, and Laconica-base server through the conversation windows. Right now it run on Linux and Windows.  </p>

<p>Please upgrade your MBPurple to 0.2.4 before reporting any bugs!   Ubuntu&#39;s PPA is available Awashiro Ikuya&#39;s PPA repository README is here Version 0.2.4 is released (26/9/2009)Fix &quot;Twitpocalypse2&quot; where mbpurple download whole lots of old tweets over and over. This bug occurred on some platform (as of now Windows XP seems to be affected by this) Fix reply and retweet links for Pidgin 2.6. Fix stability bug that crash Pidgin when connection is unstable All users are recommended to upgrade to 0.2.4, and also upgrade your Pidgin to 2.6.1 at the least. Ubuntu user please consider using Pidgin PPA built from Pidgin team to upgrade your Pidgin (instruction here) </p>

<p>Will available on PPA soon. </p>

<p>Version 0.2.2 is released (14/6/2009)Fix id overflow (receiving duplicate tweets) bug for twitter.com Add CACerts to windows installer Fix few minor bugs Plug-in for Adium is also released! Thanks to @jsippel. Another new release for Adium (21/5/2009)This release update libpurple Courtesy goes to @jsippel! Download it here Version 0.2.1 is released (3/3/2009)Don&#39;t forget to enable Twitgin in Tools-&gt;Plugin </p>

<p>This version contain major bug fixes and some improvements </p>

<p>Twitter, Identica, and Laconica now serve mainly as protocol only plug-in. You need to enable Twitgin in order to get old fancy output in conversation windows Fix SSL connection bug that may crash Pidgin when connection is unstable Clicking reply link now add in_reply_to_id http parameter (make the message appear sa &quot;reply to message&quot; in web-site) Remove &quot;twitter.com&quot; label. Now conversation showed as if coming from each individual user Add * (Favorite) and RT (Retweet) link for easy favorite and retweet (thanks to @nopparat) Move &quot;Enable reply link&quot; preference to Twitgin &quot;Configure plug-in&quot;.  We are also working on Adium port of MBPurple. Hopefully this will be released very soon! </p>

<p>Version 0.2.0 is released (7/11/2008)This is a new major release with some more features, along with major code restructure. This release only works with Pidgin 2.5.x </p>

<p>Beta support for Identi.ca and Laconica, as separated plug-ins. A bit of improvement in message display Improve Twitgin support, no self-generated message also being renice Support for 2 commands, right now it only works for Twitter. /replies - get replies timeline /refresh - get new tweets immediately /tag, /btag, /untag - automatically tag all your message, good for tagging messages with some hash tag (Example: #election2008). Lots more configurable options in Plug-in. </p>

<p>Don&#39;t forget to enable Twitgin to see new features! </p>

<p>Note that, this new version is INCOMPATIBLE with older version. You will need to remove and re-add the plug-in to get all new features. </p>

<p>Version 0.1.2 is released (16/8/2008)This release fix &amp;nbsp;issue#17&amp;nbsp; which can crash Pidgin when clicking &quot;reconnect&quot; or Pidgin do automatic reconnect.</p>

 title : The milleniumarterials Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The mimeparse Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This module provides basic functions for parsing mime-type names and matching them against a list of media-ranges. </p>

<p>See section 14.1 of RFC 2616 (the HTTP specification) for a complete explanation. More information on the library can be found in the XML.com article Just use Media Types? </p>

<p>Contents</p>

<p>parse_mime_type()   Parses a mime-type into its component parts.   parse_media_range()   Media-ranges are mime-types with wild-cards and a &#39;q&#39; quality parameter.   quality()   Determines the quality (&#39;q&#39;) of a mime-type when compared against a list of media-ranges.   quality_parsed()   Just like quality() except the second parameter must be pre-parsed.   fitness_and_quality_parsed()   Just like quality_parsed() but also returns the fitness score.   best_match()   Choose the mime-type with the highest fitness score and quality (&#39;q&#39;) from a list of candidates.  </p>

<p>UsageIn Erlang1&gt; mimeparse:best_match([&quot;application/xbel+xml&quot;, &quot;text/xml&quot;], &quot;text/*;q=0.5,*/*; q=0.1&quot;).
<br/>&quot;text/xml&quot;Note that neither quality_parsed() nor fitness_and_quality_parsed() are exported from the Erlang version. </p>

<p>In JavaScriptRhino 1.7 release 1 2008 03 06
<br/>js&gt; load(&#39;mimeparse.js&#39;);
<br/>js&gt; Mimeparse.bestMatch([&#39;application/xbel+xml&#39;, &#39;text/xml&#39;], &#39;text/*;q=0.5,*/*; q=0.1&#39;);
<br/>text/xmlThis example uses the Rhino JavaScript shell but usage should be similar for other JavaScript environments. </p>

<p>In Perluse MIMEParse qw( best_match );
<br/>print best_match([&#39;application/xbel+xml&#39;, &#39;text/xml&#39;], &#39;text/*;q=0.5,*/*; q=0.1&#39;);
<br/># text/xmlIn PHPinclude_once &#39;mimeparse.php&#39;;</p>

<p>echo Mimeparse::best_match(array(&#39;application/xbel+xml&#39;, &#39;text/xml&#39;),
<br/>  &#39;text/*;q=0.5,*/*; q=0.1&#39;);
<br/>    ==&gt;&quot;text/xml&quot;In Python&gt;&gt;&gt; import mimeparse
<br/>&gt;&gt;&gt; mimeparse.best_match([&#39;application/xbel+xml&#39;, &#39;text/xml&#39;], 
<br/>      &#39;text/*;q=0.5,*/*; q=0.1&#39;)
<br/>&#39;text/xml&#39;In Rubyrequire &quot;mimeparse&quot;
<br/>    ==&gt;true
<br/>MIMEParse.best_match([&#39;application/xbel+xml&#39;, &#39;text/xml&#39;],
<br/>  &#39;text/*;q=0.5,*/*; q=0.1&#39;)
<br/>    ==&gt;&quot;text/xml&quot;In JavaList mimeTypesSupported = Arrays.asList(StringUtils.split(
<br/>                &quot;application/xbel+xml,text/xml&quot;, &#39;,&#39;));
<br/>String bestMatch = MIMEParse.bestMatch(mimeTypesSupported, &quot;text/*;q=0.5,*/*;q=0.1&quot;);In Goimport &quot;mimeparse&quot;</p>

<p>bestmatch := mimeparse.BestMatch([&quot;application/xbel+xml&quot;, &quot;text/xml&quot;], 
<br/>  &quot;text/*;q=0.5,*/*; q=0.1&quot;);</p>
 title : The mimetest Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is a plugin for Ruby on Rails which provides a collection of test helper methods to simplify testing resource-oriented, REST-ful controllers or any action which handles alternative MIME content types.</p>
 title : The mimetype-fu Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>What is it?Some great Rails plugins like attachment_fu use the content type/mime type of a file to validate the instance of an object. The plugin usually gets the mime type using the CGI request, however, if the file is already in the system, this approach won&#39;t work. Adobe Flash is also known not to send the proper mime type. As an alternative, I wrote mimetype_fu, a simple plugin which will try to retrieve the mimetype. </p>

<p>Note that mimetype_fu used to only looks at the extension to define its mime type, that&#39;s not true anymore, this nifty little plugin uses your os to open the file and check on the header for the mime type :) (sorry windows users, mimetype will only check on the file extension) </p>

<p>How to use it?mimetype_fu extends the File class: </p>

<p>&gt;&gt; @file = File.open(&quot;#{RAILS_ROOT}/test/test.mp3&quot;) </p>

<p>=&gt; # </p>

<p>&gt;&gt; File.mime_type?(@file) </p>

<p>=&gt; &quot;audio/mpeg&quot; </p>

<p>You can also get the mime type of the file by only passing its path: </p>

<p>&gt;&gt; File.mime_type?(&#39;test.jpg&#39;) </p>

<p>=&gt; &quot;image/jpeg&quot;   </p>

<p>How to install mimetype_fuscript/plugin install http://mimetype-fu.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ </p>

<p>(don&#39;t forget to rename the plugin folder) </p>

<p>You can also use svn: </p>

<p>cd vendor/plugins </p>

<p>svn checkout http://mimetype-fu.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ mimetype-fu </p>

<p>FYI: mimetype-fu is moving to github: http://github.com/matta/mimetype-fu/tree  Feel free to fork mimetype-fu and send me a pull request</p>
 summary : <p>Mindstorm is a assoiciative Neural Network that attempts to model the interacts between the Hippocampal System and the neocortex in the human brain. The goal of the project is to create a robust NN where associations can be formed from a variety of environments and recalled as needed to aide in the learning and adaption process.</p>

 title : The mindtree Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>AboutMindTree is an information outliner application designed for recording and organizing notes and publishing these notes to the web. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>PyEnchant must be installed separately if you want to use the spell checker tool. </p>

<p>FeaturesGeneralFull UNICODE support.  All tree entires and Articles can contain UNICODE characters. Pluggable architecture.  tools and importers/exporters are all plugins.  New plugins can be easily added without changes to the main application. The current release runs on Python 2.5 -- This version has reached end-of-life.  Future releases will run on Python 2.6 with PyQt. Outline TreeDrag-N-Drop.  Tree nodes may be moved around by dragging them with your mouse. Mouse-less tree editing.  If using the mouse is tedious for you move tree entires using tab, shift-tab and shift arrow keys. In-place-editing.  Tree entries can be edited in-place Article EditingText Styling.  Articles support a wide range of styling capabilities. Embedded images.  Articles support embedding .png images. ToolsBuild Web sites.  Export an entire outline to a web site complete with side-by-side panes and fully interactive tree.  The generated website looks like a read-only version of MindTree. Spell checking Search and replace Customizable On-Screen Keyboards for characters not on the computer keyboard. CompatibilityThe current version runs on Python 2.5. Soon to be released, updated version to run on Python 2.6.</p>
 title : The mingus Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>mingusWhat&#39;s mingus?Intervals, Chords, Scales and Progressionsmingus is a package for Python used by programmers, musicians, composers and researchers to make and investigate music. At the core of mingus is music theory, which includes topics like intervals, chords, scales and progressions. These components are rigurously tested and can be used to generate and recognize musical elements using convenient shorthand where possible (for example some acceptable chords are: &quot;CM7&quot;, &quot;Am6&quot;, &quot;Ab7&quot;, &quot;G7&quot;). </p>

<p>Bars, Tracks and CompositionsOn top of the core are data structures (mingus.containers) that make it easier to work with notes in bars, tracks and compositions. These containers lay the foundation for the remaining packages: midi and extra.  </p>

<p>MIDI and SequencingThe MIDI package can save and load MIDI files, and -last but not least- provides a general purpose sequencer for all the containers and a FluidSynth sequencer subclass. This allows you to play all your data structures straight from Python in just a couple of lines. Most of the icky timing and MIDI code has been abstracted away for you, leaving a clean, relatively simple API. </p>

<p>ExtraLastly, the extra package includes a LilyPond exporter which can be used to create sheet music in PDF, PNG and postscript. It also offers ASCII tablature and MusicXML exporting and a sound analysis module which can recognize notes and melody in raw audio data.  </p>

<p>Learn More About Mingus in the Wiki </p>

<p>Latest news2009/12/08 -- Arun Chaganty converted the repository to mercurial, which will hopefully improve our development process. You can still see the old subversion repository here, but it will not be updated. 2009/07/07 -- Version 0.4.2.3: Features a new MusicXML module by Javier Palanca and a new SequencerObserver module that can be attached to a Sequencer. Also includes a full copy of the license, a THANKS and an AUTHORS file and updates to the copyright information; so that we can get included in the next Ubuntu release. Release notes. 2009/07/02 -- Version 0.4.2.0: Contains the new tunings module, with information about the different kind of tunings for various instruments, and the tablature module built on top of that, which can export all the mingus.containers to pretty ASCII tabs. See the release notes for more details and some examples. 2009/06/29 -- Opened a new mailing list targeted specifically at developers and people wishing to follow the project closely. For all commit logs, issue updates and code discussion see mingus-devel See the complete change log here </p>

<p>ContactFor questions, patches, recommendations and requests, you can contact the mingus google group. </p>

<p>  </p>

<p>Visit this group </p>

<p>IRCYou can talk to us on freenode.net in the #mingus channel.</p>

 title : The minib3d-unstable Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>MiniB3D is a simple 3d engine written for BlitzMax created by Simon Harrison. It features an elegant design inspired by Blitz 3D (by Mark Sibly / Blitz Research Ltd). Because MiniB3D is an OpenGL engine written for BlitzMax - an easily cross-platform programming language - it runs smoothly in Linux, Mac OS and Windows. </p>

<p>MiniB3D is open source and freely available, though only of real interest to users who own BlitzMax] or people who are interested in 3d OpenGL engines. </p>

<p>Simon Harrison&#39;s MiniB3D is built to be simple and very much like Blitz3D in terms of its features. This project aims to easily integrate peoples&#39; enhancements that do not quite fit in to the original MiniB3D, while at the same time upholding the original clean feel of the engine. </p>

<p>Discussion of MiniB3D as well as stable releases and SVN snapshots can be found in the discussion group].</p>

 summary : <p>This application is a simple middleware and associated decorator that will add a &quot;.mobile&quot; attribute to your request objects, which, if True, means the requester is coming to you from a mobile phone (cellphone), PDA, or other device that should be considered small screened, or have an underpowered browser, such as games consoles. </p>

<p>This mostly works using a list of search strings, though there are a couple of other tricks, like detecting the presence of Opera Mini. The strings are in an easily-parseable text file, and thus can be used for other similar projects. </p>

<p>It also includes a pretty extensive list of user agents to test against. </p>

 summary : <p>MiniMyth is a small GNU/Linux distribution that turns a diskless computer into a MythTV frontend and slave backend. It is built from source using a GAR based build system. It supports both network and local boot, with network boot being the primary boot method. It supports a range of hardware that is particularly well suited for use as a MythTV frontend, with a particular focus on NVIDIA ION and VIA EPIA hardware. </p>

<p>The MiniMyth build system, initialization scripts, runtime scripts and documentation are licensed under the MIT license. As is the case with every GNU/Linux distribution, the third party software packages (e.g. Linux, Xorg and MythTV) included in the MiniMyth Linux distribution are licensed under their respective licenses.</p>
