 title : The ofcgwt Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OverviewThe OFCGWT project provides a simple to use chart widget for GWT based on Open Flash Chart 2. The library includes the needed flash insertion, update and manipulation methods for the chart widget. It also includes a POJO model for the chart elements and components that assist in the generation of the JSON to provide the correct chart data for OFC 2.x API.  </p>

<p>The project has released a beta of version 2.x and a stable 1.3.x release - with over 12,000+ downloads !! </p>

<p>Note: A beta of v2.0 (GWT 1.6 support) does contain breaking API for those coming from the 1.X version of OFCGWT - it contains new refactored events and a new chart factory, better attach/detach support, new charts features(new Horizontal Stack Bar Chart, enhanced animations based on OFC Ichor with DZ fixes and patches). </p>

<p>Current Status2009-Apr-21: Version 2.0.1 beta released.DemoNew Std Demo - Added Transparent Image Bar Chart Events Demo - onClick Events Demo showing drill-down Note: Source code for both demos and more is available in the SVN (click the source tab above and browse to the /trunk/test folder). </p>

<p> </p>

<p>History2009-Apr-15: Version 2.0 beta released. 2009-Feb-13: Version 1.3.0 released. Fixed pie size, transparent background. New demos updated. 2009-Jan-29: Version 1.2.5 released. Several fixes (latest SWF OFC file added)  2009-Jan-08: Version 1.2.4 released. Fixed an json load JS method ready bug 2009-Jan-07: Version 1.2.3 released. Fixed an attach/detach bug 2008-Dec-28: Version 1.2.2 released. Fixed right Y Axis &amp; stackbar keys support 2008-Dec-08: Version 1.2 released. Adds new Cylinder Charts!! 2008-Nov-16: Version 1.1 released. New onClick event support!! 2008-Nov-06: Version 1.0.3 released. Bug fixes for issues 7,8,9 &amp; 11. 2008-Oct-23: Version 1.0.2 released. Bug fix for stack-bar charts and demo update. 2008-Oct-18: Version 1.0.1 released. New charts, updates to OFC and new demo. 2008-Oct-12: Version 1.0.0 released.  2008-Oct-05: Memory leak found in OFC - a patched SWF file produced.  2008-Aug-31: Docs finalised, full OFCv2 Beta1 support, beta6 released.  2008-Aug-30: Minor Fix, license change to LGPL, beta5 released.  2008-Aug-28: Further Fixes, API refactor, updated demo, api docs : beta4 released.  2008-Aug-22: Further Fixes, event notification, updated demo : beta3 released.  2008-Aug-21: Fixes, resize bug, ExtJS GWT demo and docs : beta2 released.  2008-Aug-19: OFCGWT updated release and demo : beta1 released.  2008-Aug-17: OFCGWT initial release made available.</p>

 title : The official-website-jnv-raisen Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ABOUT JAWAHAR NAVODAYA VIDYALAYA SCHEME </p>

<p>National integration should inform the activity of the Government and the people alike. One way of bringing this about is to orient the education of boys and girls towards integration at an early age. One important vehicle of integration is the curriculum adumbrated in the New Education Policy. The core curriculum would naturally and inevitably contain inputs from all regions all the country and contribution from the states in ample measure. In mobility of students across the country is another crucial factor. Another important measure is the opportunity afforded to students at an impressionable age, to live and learn along with their peers from states other than their own and to get acquainted with, and motivated by experiences of National Integration in action.  </p>

<p>It has been well accepted that children with special talent or aptitude should be provided opportunities to proceed at a faster pace than others. Such children are in fact found in all section of people and in all areas including the backward. However, good quality education has been available only to well-to-do sections of society, the poor have been left out. Keeping in view these considerations, the Education Commission (1964-66) had recommended selection of a certain percentage of schools as pace setter institutions. But due to the reasons it is not practicable to select schools, institutions within the existing system for a pace-setter improvement program  and therefore :- in accordance to the National Policy of Education (1986) Government of India started Navodaya Vidyalaya  (Presently known as Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya) on an average one in each district, during the seventh five year plan. The constituted board for the purpose, aims for establishing of Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalayas are to serve the objective of excellence to develop their full potential and facilitate the process of school improvement. </p>

<p>Future Expansion Plans : 1. In His telecast to the Nation on 22 March, 1998, Honorable Prime Minister of India Proposed twenty fold expansion of Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya scheme. 2. Proposed to cover 568 District during 10th Plan. 3. Award to the Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalayas in the CBSE public examination as well as to the outstanding teachers of the JNVs for their meritorious services to the children and to the Nation. </p>

<p>EXSISTANCE OF JAWAHAR NAVODAYA VIDYALAYA RAISEN 
<br/>In the above reference, Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya Raisen came to existence as Co-Educational Residential School during 23rd March 1992 at Bari, a place 100km away from the capital city Bhopal on the National Highway No. 12 (Jaipur-Bhopal-Jabalpur Road). The nearest railway stations  to reach Bari are : Pipariya-65km, Itarsi (via Hoshangabad)- 75km, Bhopal-100km and Jabalpur- 265km. However, frequent buses ply between Bhopal-Jabalpur, Itarsi-Hoshangabad-Baktara-Bari-Bareli, and Pipariya-Bareli-Bari.  </p>

<p>FINANCIAL MATTER : Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya Raisen is fully financed by the Government of India through an autonomous organization - Navodaya Vidyalaya Samiti (NVS), under the Ministry of Human Resource Development (HRD).  </p>

<p>VIDYALAYA MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE (VMC) : The Vidyalaya Management committee works as advisory body to supervise general functioning of the Vidyalaya.  more.........    </p>

<p>SELECTION PROCEDURE : As a policy matter, 75% and 25% of children belong to rural and urban area respectively are selected for admission in class 6th through selection test (JNVST) conducted by Central Board of Secondary Education, New Delhi (NV Cell), every academic year  and in 9th class  against dropped  out or vacant seat (s). EFFORTS ARE BEING MADE TO ENSURE THAT ONE THIRD OF STUDENTS ARE GIRLS. </p>

<p>more...... RESULT UPDATE FOR JNVST 2007  
<br/>AFFILIATION : Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya, Raisen is affiliated to the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE), New Delhi and students of the Vidyalaya appear for 10th and 12th class examination of the CBSE.  </p>

<p>  </p>

<p>STREAM : We provide Science stream to the children of class 12th with specialization in Computer Science, (IT )as optional subject,  so that children may gain best specialized professional knowledge  and get benefited with the modern technology. more.........  </p>

<p>  </p>

<p>SCOPE : WHY YOU SHOULD GET YOUR CHILD ADMITTED IN JAWAHAR NAVODAYA VIDYALAYA , RAISEN : Full  scope are being provided to the children for innovation and experimentation in the Vidyalaya. The entire activity is organized inter alia with a view to remove psychosocial impediments to the development of personality and educational attainment because of complex and prejudices transmitted through the social environment and the accident of birth.  </p>

<p>FEES : While education is free including boarding and lodging, uniform, text books and stationary, a nominal fee of Rs. 200/- will have to be paid by the children from class 9th . However, children belonging to SC/ST, Girls, Physically Handicapped and from the families whose income is below poverty line are exempted from paying fees.  </p>

<p>TO GIVE EMPHASIS ON NATIONAL INTEGRATION POLICY 30% STUDENTS FROM THE VIDYALAYA WILL BE MIGRATED TO JAWAHAR NAVODAYA VIDYALAYA, RAJKOT, GUJARAT FOR ONE ACADEMIC YEAR.  </p>

<p>VISIT CORRESPONDING PAGES FOR ................. 
<br/>    Excellence award </p>

<p>Pottery workshop </p>

<p>Girls NCC  </p>

<p>  </p>

<p>Scout  </p>

<p>  </p>

<p>Science laboratory  </p>

<p>FOR LINK  : </p>

<p>Welcome to the official website of Navodaya Vidyalaya Samiti </p>

<p>Click Here to Enter </p>

<p>http--www.cbse.nic.in </p>

<p>LINK TO USEFUL WEB SITES FOR TEACHERS AND STUDENTS </p>

<p>www.aicte.ernet.in </p>

<p>www.indianrail.gov.in</p>
 summary : <p>Descriptionofx-parser is an OFX 1.x parser written in Ruby. </p>

<p>FeaturesReads OFX responses - i.e. those downloaded from financial institutions and puts it into a usable object graph. Supports the 3 main message sets: banking, credit card and investment accounts, as well as the required &#39;sign on&#39; set. Knows about SIC codes - if your institution provides them. See http://www.eeoc.gov/stats/jobpat/siccodes.html Monetary amounts can be retrieved either as a raw string, or in pennies. Supports OFX timestamps. SynopsisSupports bank accounts: </p>

<p>  require &#39;rubygems&#39;
<br/>  require &#39;ofx-parser&#39;</p>

<p>  ofx = OfxParser::OfxParser.parse(open(&quot;bank-statement.ofx&quot;))</p>

<p>  ofx.bank_account.number # =&gt; &#39;103333333333&#39;
<br/>  ofx.bank_account.routing_number # =&gt; &#39;033000033&#39;
<br/>  ofx.bank_account.balance # =&gt; &#39;123.45&#39;
<br/>  ofx.bank_account.balance_in_pennies # =&gt; 12345</p>

<p>  ofx.bank_account.statement.start_date # =&gt; DateTime
<br/>  ofx.bank_account.statement.end_date # =&gt; DateTime</p>

<p>  ofx.bank_account.statement.transactions.size # =&gt; 4</p>

<p>  ofx.bank_account.statement.transactions.first.payee # =&gt; &quot;FOO, INC.&quot;
<br/>  ofx.bank_account.statement.transactions.first.type # =&gt; :DEBIT
<br/>  ofx.bank_account.statement.transactions.first.amount # =&gt; &#39;-11.11&#39;
<br/>  ofx.bank_account.statement.transactions.first.amount_in_pennies # =&gt; -1111Also supports credit cards... </p>

<p>  ofx = OfxParser::OfxParser.parse(open(&quot;creditcard-statement.ofx&quot;))</p>

<p>  ofx.credit_card.remaining_credit # =&gt; &#39;19000.0&#39;
<br/>  ofx.credit_card.remaining_credit_in_pennies # =&gt; &#39;1900000&#39;</p>

<p>  ofx.credit_card.statement.start_date # =&gt; DateTime
<br/>  ofx.credit_card.statement.end_date # =&gt; DateTime</p>

<p>  ofx.credit_card.statement.transactions.size # =&gt; 10</p>

<p>  ofx.credit_card.statement.transactions.first.type # =&gt; :DEBIT
<br/>  ofx.credit_card.statement.transactions.first.amount # =&gt; &#39;-19.17&#39;
<br/>  ofx.credit_card.statement.transactions.first.amount_in_pennies # =&gt; &#39;-1917&#39;
<br/>  ofx.credit_card.statement.transactions.first.sic # =&gt; &#39;7933&#39;
<br/>  ofx.credit_card.statement.transactions.first.sic_desc # =&gt; &#39;BOWLING CENTERS&#39;
<br/>  ofx.credit_card.statement.transactions.first.payee # =&gt; &#39;SUNSET BOWLING&#39;Working on investment accounts... </p>

<p>Requirementshpricot &gt;= 0.6 Installgem install ofx-parser LicenseCopyright (c) 2007, Andrew A. Smith
<br/>All rights reserved.</p>

 title : The ofx-parser Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is my test Project, </p>
 title : The ofytest Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The ogmaps Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>AboutI ordered a Nokia N800 a day or two ago, and thought &quot;man, wouldn&#39;t it be nice to be able to use Google Maps around town even when this thing doesn&#39;t have an internet connection?&quot;  Well, a few hours and ~200 lines of code later: the answer is definitely &quot;heck yeah&quot;.  =P </p>

<p>This tool downloads and builds a version of Google Maps that will run completely off your own system, with no internet connection, HTTP servers, etc. required, and uses the same web2.0 UI you&#39;re familiar with.  If your device has a web browser, you&#39;re pretty much good to go. </p>

<p>DownloadingAssuming you have subversion installed, run the following command: </p>

<p>$ svn checkout http://ogmaps.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ ogmapsThis will create a directory ogmaps and download all the relevant files. </p>

<p>InstructionsChange to the directory created above. run: python ogmaps.py &quot;plano, tx&quot; (replace &quot;plano, tx&quot; with wherever) while your internet connection is working open the file &quot;ogmap.html&quot; in your web browser (later, when your internet connection is down) FAQHow does this work?The script downloads all the HTML, Javascript and images Google Maps uses, and saves them to your hard drive.  It then, through the magic of regular expressions and BeautifulSoup, transmographies the files as necessary to use the data it downloaded a moment earlier. </p>

<p>How much drive space does this use?That depends on how many locations you download, but it should be less than 10MB per site.  It&#39;s smart enough to know what it has and hasn&#39;t downloaded already, and not re-request the same information.  It downloads data for all zoom levels, but to avoid exponential growth only looks at a fixed pixel radius (~3072px / 12 tiles) around whatever point you&#39;re looking at. </p>

<p>Isn&#39;t this illegal / against Google&#39;s TOC / stealing?I doubt it.  Just don&#39;t use the images for anything other than personal use and you should be fine.  But if this project disappears suddenly, check out my blog at http://kered.org/blog for where I&#39;ll re-host it. </p>

<p>Will this work on my N770/N800/N810?Heck if I know.  I&#39;m still waiting for the FedEx guy! </p>

<p>How can I help?To help the project, file a bug for any errors or feature requests you have, and/or join the list.  To help me personally, check out my company&#39;s site: http://allurstuff.com (it&#39;s basically craigslist fused with google maps).</p>

 title : The ojay Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Ojay: a developer-friendly wrapper for the Yahoo! User Interface libraryCopyright (c) 2007-08 the OTHER media Limited, written by James Coglan. </p>

<p>http://ojay.othermedia.org </p>

<p>INTRODUCTIONOjay is a JavaScript programming interface that wraps the Yahoo! User Interface library. It aims to make code easier to read and write, by allowing more sentence-like OO syntax and minimizing repetition. </p>

<p>Further information and docs are available on the Ojay site: http://ojay.othermedia.org </p>

<p>HELP? FEEDBACK?Leave a message in the discussion group: http://groups.google.com/group/ojay-talk/      </p>

<p>DEVELOPMENTIf you&#39;re checking this code out from the repository, you&#39;ll need to build the library from the source files (contained in the /source directory). To do this, you&#39;ll need Ruby installed. You can get Ruby for any platform from their web site: </p>

<p>http://www.ruby-lang.org/en/downloads/ </p>

<p>You&#39;ll also need the Jake gem to generate build files, and the staticmatic gem to view the doc site and run tests. </p>

<p>gem install jake
<br/>gem install staticmaticOnce you&#39;ve got Ruby installed, open a command prompt in the root directory (one level up from /source) and type &#39;jake&#39;. That command will combine and compress the source files and place them in the /build directory. Note that you must build the library from within the Subversion working copy, as the build process uses SVN to extract version information. </p>

<p>To start a server for the docs/test site, type </p>

<p>staticmatic preview site </p>

<p>The site is then available at http://localhost:3030, and the test suite at http://localhost:3030/test/</p>
 summary : <p>OJS is a library that allows you to deal with individual &#39;components&#39; (like a login form, a div representing a comment, a grid, etc.) on a page as objects, with classes, inheritance and all that OOP goodness. </p>

<p>StateALPHA 0.000000001 </p>

<p>IntroductionFor a nice introduction, see WhyOJS and Guide. </p>

<p>For a dense and jargon-filled introduction, see below. </p>

<p>Executive SummaryOstensibly, this simply means separating the &quot;behavior&quot; layer of your page from the structural HTML itself, much like CSS separates the visual presentation layer. The idea is in line with other approaches to &quot;unobtrusive javascript&quot; (google it). </p>

<p>OJS does this in a way more familiar to object-oriented (desktop) GUI development. It allows you to define controller classes, which receive events from a particular group of elements on the page, perform high level operations with the group as a whole, and store relevant state information. This is a much more maintainable and modular approach than inline javascript, and even the &quot;event selector&quot; approach (a.k.a. Behavior.js) which, although a big step up, still doesn&#39;t make it easy to deal with &quot;components&quot; on the page as a cohesive unit. </p>

<p>OJS makes extensive use of classes and inheritance to provide common functionality out of the box. For instance, if all your form controllers inherit from the built-in FormController class, validation, loading indicators and error notification methods will become available and you can deal with them in a neatly consistent fashion. You could also inherit from AjaxFormController instead ( a subclass of FormController) which simply performs an AJAX request instead of refreshing the page (and provides additional callbacks for handling responses). </p>

<p>To make all of this practical, OJS also provides a number of tools (available in a rails plugin): </p>

<p>1) The OJS Translator allows you to write your JavaScript? code using actual class declarations (&quot;class Foo : Bar { ... }&quot;) with super() calls and class method inheritance. It also provides some much-needed syntax sugar, such as Ruby-style string interpolation ( #&quot;Hello #{user.name}&quot; ), unless statements (negated if), #foreach (simple macro for efficient native loops, when prototype&#39;s .each() is needless overhead). </p>

<p>2) JavaScript event-dispatching, which is a very efficient way of handling events for a large number of elements on a page without extensive processing on page load (&quot;event selector&quot; approaches can noticeably slow down page load when applicable and dealing with large pages). The event-dispatcher uses event-bubbling and an HTML ID naming convention to handle any number of events with just one page-wide event listener. </p>

<p>3) The OJS Loader, which dynamically creates packages from many JS files (OJS tends to encourage many small JS, specialized files, instead of a few monolithic ones), limiting JS-file requests to the server to 3 per page, while balancing needless re-downloading and caching. </p>

<p>4) A set of Rails view helpers that make it easy to write HTML using the ID conventions. (They also provide functionality similar to Rails&#39; built-in form helpers, such as pre-filling field values in an edit form) </p>

<p>5) (Coming Soon™) HTML templates that can be shared between Ruby and Javascript (i.e., you can create HTML using just Javascript, from the same template Ruby uses on the server side without an AJAX call). They work within RHTML and the above-mentioned view helpers, but only support a very minimal amount of &#39;smarts&#39;.</p>

 title : The ollie Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OllieThe Overly Lucid Lisp Interactive Editor </p>

<p>Ollie has the lofty ambition of being a complete replacement for emacs and vi. It is completely modular with implementation residing in a collection of libraries. Users and third party developers are encouraged to re-write / replace / re-use the Ollie Libraries in their own projects. The Ollie philosophy is the create a core editor engine that can be embedded and re-used in multiple projects using multiple toolkits and possibly multiple languages. </p>

<p>Our hope is that third party developers will be able to take Ollie core library and create editor front ends for a variety of projects. Possible uses for Ollie would be  </p>

<p>KDevelop Integration Mono Develop Integration Eclipse Integration Visual Studio ? Others.... In addition to the Ollie library we have plans to include a fully functional standalone editor written as a KDE Kpart Component. </p>

<p>In short every conceivable part of Ollie will be completely modular and re-usable. </p>

<p>MediaWiki for this project git repository  Google Code wishesI wish more love was given to the wiki, Media Wiki has more features and looks great I wish I could host my code as a &#39;git&#39; repository, I don&#39;t use svn.</p>

 title : The onefish Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>onefish  ... all we need is one fish ... or better yet one big Java EE project </p>

<p>AbstractThis web application will provide project management tools that help with the development of open source projects.  It will be a web application and will utilize Seam, and Java Server Faces. </p>

<p>DescriptionAn application is needed that keeps track of resources and how they may or are assigned to use-case development.  I think the use-case to developer scoping is very efficient.  It gives each developer to do many different types of developer tasks and also introduces him to the various areas of the system architecture.  I&#39;ve used this method of project management and it&#39;s effective.  </p>

<p>Also, a project management tool that tracks iterations, time, resources, and use-case development would be a valuable tool for estimating work on large Java EE projects. </p>

<p>We have not determined the best approach to conveying requirements.  Another project http://code.google.com/p/leader uses Ruby on Rails to model a prototype for the application and it&#39;s code is part of the project source.  This may be too much, but the goal is to provide understanding for the developers to make progress. </p>

<p>If this project gets larger and more popular, we will obtain more enterprise tooling and that will help with management of work and direction.</p>

 title : The online-note Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>我一直在使用 NoteZilla 做桌面便签, 记录些事情非常方便. NoteZilla 作为一个桌面便签软件, 可以说已经做的很到位了, 很多非常不错的功能, 随便列举一些, 如: 便签分类, 窗口绑定, 定义 tag, 高级搜索, 定时提醒, 随机背景色, 全局快捷键支持等等. </p>

<p>比较可惜的是 NoteZilla 是单机软件, 不能共享数据(只提供一个利用监听端口传送数据的功能, 不是很方便), 这方面不如 Google Notebook, 可以把数据保存在网络上, 只要登录就能取回数据, 但 Google Notebook 也有缺点, 就是不管是在站点中还是使用插件, 都离不开浏览器, 这样对于便签软件来说便捷性大打折扣. </p>

<p>基于对以上两个软件的不满, OnlineNote 的雏形诞生了, 她将集成两个软件的优点, 摒弃不足, 初步设想可能只做一些最基本的功能, 客户端使用 Adobe Air 技术实现, 用户需要进行安装 Adobe Air Runtime, 后台数据保存和处理使用 PHP + MySQL. </p>

<p>本人水平有限, Air 也是初学, 写这个软件有两个目的, 一是创建一个适合自己使用(符合自己使用习惯或自己需要的一些特殊功能)的便签软件, 二是利用这个项目深入学习 Air 这个划时代的将来必定大红大紫的开发工具. </p>

<p>另外, 欢迎感兴趣的朋友加入进来一起开发这个酷软 :D </p>

<p>Dofy 期待您的加入. </p>

<p>Mail/gtalk: dofyyu at gmail dot com </p>

<p>Blog: http://blog.dofy.net/</p>

<p>There exists however similar (and free) actively developed OOo plugin (http://code.google.com/p/ooo2gd/, OOo site) that incorporates almost all of the functionality provided by our modest software (and even much more). Let us recommend it to you (this words don&#39;t came easy :) ). </p>

<p>Thank you and see you next plugin :) </p>

<p>About the pluginOpenoffice plugin providing integration with GoogleDocuments and Zoho. </p>

<p>Application requirements: </p>

<p>JavaSE 6.0 Openoffice &gt;=2.3 (2.3, 2.4.1 verified) </p>

<p>Features: </p>

<p>Upload of (multiple) documents (Text, Spreadsheet, Presentation) to Zoho Download of documents (Text, Spreadsheet) from Zoho Upload of (multiple) documents (Text, Spreadsheet, Presentation) to GoogleDocuments History of actions On-line documents&#39; content searching Update of spreadsheets stored on Zoho It is still in preproduction stage; as we are still incubating stay tuned for new releases (that are to be released once a week, not once upon the time :) ). A bunch of fixes is to be implemented soon (but not very soon - we are currently heavily academically tested). </p>

BEEP.) something does not work? Share your bug with us! (using &#39;Issues&#39; tab please generate New Issue with type &#39;Bug&#39;) do you want to join our excellent team? It&#39;s now possible - share your talent with us </p>

 title : The ooofbtools Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>English: The cross platform OpenOffice.org extension OOo FBTools used to convert to and processing eBooks in FictionBook2 format. </p>

<p>Russian: Кроссплатформенный инструментарий OOo FBTools предназначен для конвертации документов из форматов, поддерживаемых OpenOffice.org Writer в формат FictionBook2. </p>

<p>Таким образом входные форматы документов для FBTools следующие: .doc, .dot, .rtf, .txt, .html, .htm, .oth, .odt, .ott, .stw, .sdw, .xml, .vor, .psw, .wps, .wpd, .fodt, .sxw, Microsoft Word 2003XML .xml, и другие, с которыми работает OpenOffice.org Writer. </p>

<p>Инструментарий работает на тех платформах, где работает OpenOffice.org Writer, т.е. MS Windows 98/2000/XP/Vista, MacOS X, GNU/Linux, FreeBSD и другие. </p>

<p>OOo FBTools не использует DOM технологию – задействован свой парсинг документов и печать в текстовый файл информации, собранной после анализа. </p>

<p>Если документ отформатирован стилями правильно, то после его конвертации практически не требуется дальнейшая правка (за редким исключением) в редакторах fb2 формата! После проведения десятков тестов с документами различной структурой, полученные fb2 книги у меня всегда проходили валидацию.</p>
 summary : <p>This project provides code samples of how to use well-known Java persistence frameworks. This project aims at easing the first steps when evaluating a (new) Java persistence framework. The provided samples will exhaustively exemplify all general features of these persistence frameworks. All samples are based on Ant and include Eclipse project settings. </p>

<p>Samplesstandard use cases hello world - setup tooling and runtime environment hidden object identity - also known as datastore identity optimitic locking - write locks using the optimitic offline lock protocol pessimistic locking - write locks using pessimistic online (database) locks attach/detach - passing persistent instances arround composite primary key - when a to-one association is part of the primary key getter/setter access - in contrast to field access in memory query - querying for uncommitted entities fields date/time big decimal large binary objects/large character objects enumerations relationships one to one: unidirectional with join column/join table, bidirectional with join column/join table, opposed FK, embedded one to many: unidirectional with join column/join table, bidirectional with join column/join table, ordered, naturally ordered, dependent many to many: unidirectional, bidirectional, ordered, naturally ordered list of primitives inheritance new table strategy superclass table strategy subclass table strategy mixed new table/superclass table strategy combined new table/superclass table strategy querying is-null queries object queries bulk update/delete queries collection queries - is-empty, none-of, any-of, all-of downcast-criterias optimizations eager fetching / lazy loading fetch plans Used FrameworksApache Cayenne 3 Milestone 3 see http://cayenne.apache.org/ native mode, JPA, JPA with XML DataNucleus Access Platform 1.1 see http://www.datanucleus.org/ JDO 2.3, JPA, JPA with XML, JPA on db4o db4objects 7 see http://www.db4o.com/ native mode (TCP mode later) EclipseLink 1.1 see http://www.eclipse.org/eclipselink/ JPA, JPA with XML Hibernate 3.3 (Core) see http://www.hibernate.org/ native mode, JPA, JPA with XML JPOX 1.2 see http://www.jpox.org/ JDO, JDO 2.1, JPA, JPA with XML Kodo 4.1 see http://www.bea.com/kodo/ JDO, JPA, JPA with XML Apache OpenJPA 1.2  see http://openjpa.apache.org/ JPA, JPA with XML Toplink Essentials see https://glassfish.dev.java.net/javaee5/persistence/ JPA, JPA with XML Oracle TopLink 11g see http://www.oracle.com/technology/products/ias/toplink/index.html native mode, native mode with XML Xcalia Intermediation Core 4.4 see http://www.xcalia.com/products/ JDO All names are trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective owners.</p>
 title : The oopex Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The opacmarc Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OpacMarc es un OPAC desarrollado en el Instituto de Matemática de Bahía Blanca (Conicet &amp; Universidad Nacional del Sur), en Argentina. </p>

<p>Puede ser visto en funcionamiento, por ejemplo, en: </p>

<p>Instituto de Matemática de Bahía Blanca (Argentina) Instituto Balseiro, S.C. de Bariloche (Argentina) Instituto Argentino de Radioastronomía Dipartimento di Fisica - Università degli Studi di Trieste; Istituto Nazionale di Fisica Nucleare - Sezione di Trieste (Italia) Biblioteca Rivadavia, Bahía Blanca (Argentina) Facultad de Ciencia y Tecnología, UADER, Entre Ríos (Argentina) Facultad de Ciencias Económicas, UNER, Entre Ríos (Argentina)  </p>

<p>El desarrollo de este software se inició en el año 2003, y desde 2004 se ha estado utilizando en algunas bibliotecas de Argentina. A fines de 2006 se publicó una primera versión --la 2006.11.13--, acompañada de una Guía de instalación. </p>

<p>En julio de 2008 hemos puesto por primera vez el código en un repositorio público. Tomamos como punto de partida la versión 2006.11.13, le fuimos agregando algunas modificaciones que se le habían realizado luego de esa fecha, y luego comenzamos una importante reorganización de la estructura de carpetas y archivos. Como consecuencia de estos cambios, la versión en SVN aún resulta inestable, pero está convergiendo a un estado satisfactorio. Llegado ese punto, publicaremos las instrucciones detalladas para la instalación. </p>

<p>Puede interesarte conocer un proyecto relacionado: Catalis. </p>

<p>ATENCION: está en desarrollo el software que próximamente reemplazará a OpacMarc: Litero. </p>

<p>EnglishOpacMarc is an OPAC developed at the Instituto de Matemática de Bahía Blanca (Conicet &amp; Universidad Nacional del Sur), in Argentina. </p>

<p>You can see it live at http://inmabb.criba.edu.ar/catalogo/ </p>

<p>Última actualización / Last updated: 2009-12-21 </p>

<p>Copyright (c) 2003-2008 Fernando J. Gómez, CONICET, and Instituto de Matemática de Bahía Blanca (INMABB)</p>

 title : Duplicate Project 669 : Duplicate Project 669 - Open Hub
 title : The open-cgf Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project provides a 3GPP-compliant Charging Gateway Function (CGF) as a sink for SGSN/GGSN/etc streamed CDRs on the 3GPP Ga/Gz interface. Refer 3GPP 32.295. These are common data elements of GSM/UMTS mobile telephone networks. This is part of the toolkit developed by 3G Telco Tools. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>The CDRs are streamed over the GTP&#39; (GTP-prime) protocol, a subset of the main GPRS Tunnelling Protocol (GTP) protocol used between the SGSN and GGSN. </p>

<p>open-cgf implements all the features of 32.295 although not all SGSN/GGSNs implement, and therefore exercise, these features. It is not yet clear if any CDFs (GGSNs/SGSNs/etc) implement the special sequence number/duplicate-avoidance features described in this standard. </p>

<p>See the Wiki current project status, we&#39;re currently testing! </p>

<p>ope</p>

 title : The open-traits Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Traits - like known from Scala (aka Ruby mix-ins) in Java. </p>

<p>Of course all but as nice and perfect as in the languages above, but this works without bytecode manipulations, is reasonable type-safe and hopefully not too hard to use. </p>

<p>As a bonus the traits here can be dynamically added and removed. </p>

<p>The intended use is compley composition where a central composition point is not practical. It is hard to find a convincing example as the code evolved from a design problem in a quite complex system.</p>
 title : The open-vcdiff Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>An encoder and decoder for the format described in RFC 3284: &quot;The VCDIFF Generic Differencing and Compression Data Format.&quot; The encoding strategy is largely based on Bentley-McIlroy 99: &quot;Data Compression Using Long Common Strings.&quot; A library with a simple API is included, as well as a command-line executable that can apply the encoder and decoder to source, target, and delta files. A slight variation from the draft standard is defined to allow chunk-by-chunk decoding when only a partial delta file window is available.</p>

 title : The openbotlist Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OverviewUpdated as of 8/2/2009: Botlist is an example application, a proof of concept demo to demonstrate how to use a JVM Language (JRuby) in a J2EE environment.  It could possibly work as a complete solution, but it is mostly an example implementation of a web application.  The source is fully available and I encourage J2EE web application developers to browse the source. </p>

<p>Google recently released news that Google&#39;s index contains one trillion URLs. This is great news that the Internet has grown to such enormous size but not that great for users that want to traverse all of that information. Google and other search engines provide applications for users to &quot;search&quot; the web and get to information they are interested based on keywords and other queries. Social networking sites turns that paradigm around a bit. Applications like Del.icio.us, Digg, Reddit and Botlist provide user portal sites for users to post their favorite links. As opposed to users querying and searching for interesting links. Users submit their links to sites like Reddit and tag them with interesting titles and keywords. Hopefully the user submitted links fall inline with content that you are also interested in. Botlist attempted to go a step further and focus on the bot/agent generated links. News aggregation and user submitted links. </p>

<p>Botlist contains an open source suite of software applications for social bookmarking and collecting online news content for use on the web.  Multiple web front-ends exist based on Django (through Google AppEngine), Rails, and J2EE.  Users and remote agents are allowed to submit interesting articles.  There are additional remote agent libraries for back-end text mining operations.  The system is broken up by the back-end specification and front-end specification. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Front-EndThe botlist web front-end displays new and interesting URLs submitted from remote agents or through user submissions.  There is also an ads listing section so that users can post personal/ad profiles.  The application itself is created with the following libraries; Liftweb and SpringMVC for the visible parts of the website, JRuby and J2EE&#39;s Spring framework for business logic and the middleware piece, Hibernate for object relational mapping (ORM). It is designed to run with Tomcat but should work with other J2EE servers. Search functionality uses the Lucene API. </p>

<p>(An additional front-end is being developed on the Hunchentoot lisp web server) </p>

<p>Other FeaturesNews aggregation (some links will be included); over half a million links thus far. </p>

<p>You can reply to comments, up or down vote the news articles, post new article links similar to other social bookmarking sites. </p>

<p>Comma delimited output for easy, text based access (for developers) Numerous documentation on architecture Discussion Forums section    User profiles    Ad/Profile listing section, listed by city   Sort search by relevancy, submit date Can also operate as a simple bug tracking system   </p>

<p>Visit Botlist Home (J2EE and Django Google AppEngine Front Ends)http://ghostbots.com/botlist/ -- J2EE Front End http://ghost-net.appspot.com/ -- Django Google AppEngine Front End) View the Sourcehttp://openbotlist.googlecode.com/svn/ </p>

<p>Project ManagementSee Botlist project through the project management site.    </p>

<p>http://code.google.com/p/openbotlist/source/list Influences and other ResourcesWeb Front Endshttp://www.reddit.com http://news.ycombinator.com/ Text and Data Mining Back Endshttp://news.google.com</p>

 title : The opencapture Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OpenCaptureOpenCapture is a java open-source document capture system.  Our goal is to provide a capture system that can cross platforms.  In the current market all major document capture systems are designed to run on the windows platform.  We hope to provide a good alternative. </p>

<p>Update 10/14/2008All, we apologize for not getting this information to you sooner.  We&#39;ve decided to not release 0.0.2 as planned.  The reason being we don&#39;t have any major updates to the code other than small bug fixes.  Also, as we&#39;ve not seen any comments or questions we believe those of you using OC are not running into any serious issues.  Release 0.0.2 will be released later this month once we&#39;ve completed buidling/testing the administration module.  If you are interested in seeing what&#39;s currently available in 0.0.2, please check CVS or drop an email and we&#39;d be happy to provide a build.  Thanks for your support and please continue to check back. </p>

<p>Update 9/25/2008OpenCapture 0.0.2 is planned for release on October 13, 2008.  This next release will contain fixes for a few bugs found as well as a new delivery plugin for Alfresco.  Please continue to check back for updated documentation and releases.   </p>

<p>OpenCapture 0.0.1 Released 9/1/2008Finally, the initial release of OC is available.  There&#39;s a long road ahead of us filled with updates and fixes so please let us know what you think.  I&#39;d also like to send out a special thanks to the folks working on the ZXing project.  Without their efforts, OC would not be possible. </p>

<p>Update 08/17/2008Beta 0.0.1 is planned for release on September 1, 2008.  The wiki is updated almost daily with new or updated information.  If you&#39;d like to get a head start, checkout the GettingStarted document along with the other configuration documentation. </p>

<p>OpenCapture 0.0.1 BetaOur first beta is just about ready.  There&#39;s a lot of configuration that has to be done in order to use the system.  We hope that this will not deter anyone from attempting to use OpenCapture.  Please continue to check back for updated information.  Also regularly check the wiki as we&#39;ll be documenting on a more frequent basis from this point forward.</p>

 title : The opencvsharp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OpenCvSharp </p>

<p>DescriptionOpenCvSharpは、OpenCVをC#やVB.NETなどの.NET Frameworkの言語から利用するためのラッパーです。大部分はC#によって書かれています。OpenCvSharpを使うと、C#やVB.NETといった言語から、簡単に、かつ高速な画像処理プログラムを作成できます。 </p>

<p>OpenCvSharp is a wrapper of OpenCV for .NET Framework written in C# and C++/CLI. You can use many popular image processing and computer vision algorithms from C#, VB.NET, etc. </p>

<p>Please correct, when I use wrong English!! </p>

<p>Featuresおそらく、OpenCvSharpはSharperCVやOpenCVDotNetといった他のOpenCVのラッパーよりも多くの関数を実装しています。 多くのクラスがIDisposableインターフェイスを実装しているので、usingを使ってスタイリッシュなコードを記述できます。 オブジェクト指向な書き方を強制しません。OpenCVのネイティブの関数をそのまま呼べます。  GDI+やWPFとの相互利用が可能です。OpenCVのIplImageとGDI+のBitmapやWPFのWriteableBitmapとの相互変換機能があります。   Probably OpenCvSharp wraps more OpenCV&#39;s functions than SharperCV and OpenCVDotNet. Many classes of OpenCvSharp implemen</p>

 title : The openeafdss Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The openface Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>There are over 33,000 Facebook applications (as of 7/08). In order to develop a Facebook application, a developer must be proficient in several languages including PHP (or Java) and JavaScript. In addition, the developer has to learn new technologies including FBML, FQL, Mock AJAX. There is an opportunity to significantly reduce the amount of effort involved in the initial learning and development as well as on-going maintenance of these applications. </p>

<p>In addition, OpenSocial is a strong alternative to the Facebook API but requires a completely different applicatin architecture. Developers find it time consuming to support both APIs in one application. This is analogous to the multi-platform support challenges of UNIX. There is no solution today to help ease this pain and we feel there is a significant opportunity to solve this problem. </p>

<p>The Openface Project is a PHP framework used for building applications that run on Facebook and OpenSocial platforms. Openface is a set of libraries that you add into your PHP application that enables the same codebase to run within Facebook, Bebo and OpenSocial containers like MySpace, Hi5 &amp; Orkut. </p>

<p>To join the project discussion, visit our Group at http://groups.google.com/group/openface. </p>

<p>Best, Dave &amp; Steve</p>

 title : The opengames Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>are you seeking for fun mobile games? You have not found it yet?! So, let&#39;s start coding one! </p>

<p>So, Why python?! Let&#39;s see how to use accelerometer in Python for S60: </p>

<p>import sensor </p>

<p># list available sensors </p>

<p>sensores = sensor.sensors()            # if acc available, connects to the service   if sensores&#39;AccSensor&#39;: </p>

<p>iAcc = sensor.Sensor(sensores[&quot;AccSensor&quot;][&quot;id&quot;], sensores[&quot;AccSensor&quot;][&quot;category&quot;]) 
<br/>iAcc.connect(sensor_handler) 
<br/># callback function </p>

<p>print str(aData[&quot;data_2&quot;]) # x

 title : The opengauge Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Welcome to the opengauge project.  An increasingly valuable collection of utilities for helping one monitor and fine tune their vehicles energy usage. </p>

<p>Two main branches of this project include MPGuino and the OBDuino.  Aptly based off of the name Arduino, which served as the base for their creation. </p>

<p>The MPGuino - Designed with accuracy and pre-OBD2 vehicles in mind, it reports all essential energy usage measurements for your car.  It can report instant and tank MPG, remaining miles till the tank is empty, and many other things in between (also in metric).  It is hooked up directly to the vehicle&#39;s speed sensor and an injector.  This project is reaching maturity and is now available in kit form. The OBDuino32K - designed to hook safely to your vehicles OBD2 port. A port available on cars manufactured after 1996.  Capable of reporting all things available on the MPGuino, with the advantage of reporting other relevant data from the vehicles array of sensors.  This would include Temperatures, Engine Load, Manifold Pressure and others.  Please choose your project of choice above. </p>

<p>If you are interested in the most up-to-date information, we suggest checking out the OpenGauge / MPGuino FE computer forum at EcoModder.com.  That is where most of the active development takes place, and where your questions can be asked and answered.</p>
 title : The opengoss Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Introduction </p>

<p>Opengoss is an open-source based, full stack network management platform. It does not provide the end-user function, but provide the developer helpful function. </p>

<p>Principle </p>

<p>Unix/Linux Based Data-Centric Web Oriented</p>
 summary : <p>See  project pages:  Home Page (All Pages) | &#39;Hello World&#39; | Code Examples | Handle Gallery | To-Do List </p>

<p>   The Last Mile - CrossTech, Oct 1, &#39;08  </p>

<p> del.icio.us </p>

<p> [ AppleScript | C | C# | Erlang | F# | Haskell | Java | JavaScript | Lisp | Logo | Perl | PHP | Prolog | Python | Ruby | Smalltalk | XSLT ]  </p>

<p>Oct 4, &#39;08 ... added JavaScript modules openhandle-0.2.1.js and openhandle-utils-0.2.1.js (together with minified versions) ... </p>

<p>OpenHandle is an open-source community project to expose Handle Values in common text-based serializations to make the data stored within the records more accessible to Web applications. OpenHandle is not a replacement for the Handle System, but rather an alternate means to access Handle. See a simple test client (sources:  html,  js). </p>

<p>Specifically, OpenHandle is implemented as a Java servlet front-end to the Handle System which exposes records in structured form (see XML and JSON examples) and as such makes Handle records readable via a simple web service. See also: </p>

<p>Home Page (All Pages) &#39;Hello World&#39; document Code Examples for  accessing OpenHandle from various programming languages Handle Gallery of Handles &#39;in the wild&#39; as serialized by OpenHandle To-Do List </p>

<p>     XML: &#39;Compact&#39; form (Link)  JSON: &#39;Compact&#39; form (Link)  </p>

<p>     XML: &#39;Full&#39; form (Link)  JSON: &#39;Full&#39; form (Link)</p>

 title : The openjtv Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The openlapi Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OpenLAPI is most commonly used to access Bluetooth GPS devices from mobile devices, whilst retaining a high level of source code compatibility with JSR-179. OpenLAPI also has a range of backends for emulating location in development environments, making it a popular tool for J2ME developers. </p>

<p>The emulator mode supports the following back-ends for determining location:- </p>

<p>Access of hardware GPS device over bluetooth (if available) Emulate a moving device from an NMEA log file (recorder application provided). Emulate a moving device from a predefined trail in a Google Earth file KML. Emulate a moving device by picking random entries from a persistent store And the software may be shipped as part of a MIDlet (Java application) to provide location awareness through the following back-ends:- </p>

<p>Access of bluetooth GPS device. Bluetooth GPS devices are very affordable. Proprietary APIs. A select number of handsets were released with GPS devices in the period before the adoption of JSR-179, and therefore have their own interface. OpenLAPI can provide a wrapper layer to hide the hardware in these cases. Log file lookup, appropriate for physically static devices It is possible to negotiate commercial arrangements with local network providers to allow location detection via CellID and other network specific techniques (e.g. angle of incidence and triangulation). A mobile phone knows which basestation it is communicating with. By knowing where the basestation is located, location awareness can be accurate to several hundred meters! </p>

<p>Similar projectsThe FLOPI (Free LOcation aPI) project is written in J2SE and is aimed at adding location awareness to desktop Java applications through many of the same back-ends as OpenLAPI. However, be warned that the author has admitted serious numerical flaws in the Coordinates.distanceTo() and Coordinates.azimuthTo() methods. OpenLAPI uses the Vincenty (1.2MB) algorithm which is guaranteed to be accurate to the μm scale. </p>

<p>LegalFor various technical and legal reasons, OpenLAPI is not referred to as an implementation of JSR-179. In order to legally refer to a piece of software as a JSR, it must pass the SUN TCK. However, as there is currently no publicly available TCK for JSR-179, it is impossible to test any implementations for 100% compliance. Included in OpenLAPI is a suite of tests for self-compliance and we invite the Open Source community to contribute to the tests. </p>

<p>HistoryOpenLAPI was developed as a side project by Samuel Halliday of ThinkTank Maths Limited in December 2006 and originally released as open source software under the GPL licence. In April 2008, the license was changed to the LGPL. The license allows both commercial entities and open source developers to make use of location services on mobile devices. However, the licence demands that any changes that are made to the OpenLAPI source code are also released under the LGPL. You do not need to open source your applications themselves to use OpenLAPI.</p>

 summary : <p>OpenSCAD is a software for creating solid 3D CAD objects.</p>

Thus it might be the application you are looking for when you are planning to create 3D models of machine parts but pretty sure is not what you are looking for when you are more interested in creating computer-animated movies.</p>

 summary : <p>OpenSteerDotNet is a port of Craig Reynolds&#39; steering behaviour library OpenSteer. </p>

<p>From OpenSteer&#39;s description: </p>

<p>&quot;OpenSteer provides a toolkit of steering behaviors, defined in terms of an abstract mobile agent called a &quot;vehicle.&quot; Sample code is provided, including a simple vehicle implementation and examples of combining simple steering behaviors to produce more complex behavior. OpenSteer&#39;s classes have been designed to flexibly integrate with existing game engines by either layering or inheritance.&quot; </p>

<p>It is Mono compatible and has been successfully used in Mogre and Unity. It should work fine with XNA Game Studio Express, including the XBox 360 runtime. </p>

<p>It also contains portions of Mogre. </p>

<p>You can see an example of OpenSteerDotNet here - For The Boids (requires Unity plugin).</p>

 summary : <p>OpenTouch is a solution for multi-modal application development. The goal of this software project is to create an open source framework that will be able to handle and process input from multi-modal devices such as multitouch screens based on FTIR. It should allow for gestural, multiple point interfaces, and a non-programming approach to gesture prototyping. </p>

<p>The OpenTouch platform aims to be a layer between the input device and the final GUI application. It&#39;s designed to be cross-platform with support for internal and external applications as simple application gateway, blob tracking, gesture recognition and much more.</p>

 title : The openvanilla Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Mac 版本使用者，請改至 github 取得最新版本： http://github.com/lukhnos/openvanilla-oranje/downloads ，並請參考 0.9.0a1 的版本發佈說明： http://github.com/lukhnos/openvanilla-oranje/blob/master/Documents/20090826-Announcement.markdown  </p>

<p>The source tree for the Mac version has been moved to http://github.com/lukhnos/openvanilla-oranje  </p>

<p>OpenVanilla is an input method project. An input method is a system software program that people use to enter characters not found on their keyboards. The Project includes a large collection of Traditional and Simplified Chinese input methods as well as support for Taiwanese, Japanese, Tibetan, Unicode symbols, among others. </p>

<p>Input method development used to be platform-dependent. OpenVanilla provides a lightweight API that simplifies the process. Because of its minimalistic design, OpenVanilla is highly portable. Input method modules developed with OpenVanilla&#39;s API run smoothly on Mac OS X, Linux/FreeBSD, and Windows. </p>

<p>The Project also explores the possibilities of input method design. Topics include better user interface design and use cases beyond Asian languages. It&#39;s an open source project, participation welcome! </p>

<p>OpenVanilla（開放香草輸入法計劃）提供多種輸入法工具，可以在Mac OS X、Linux/FreeBSD/Windows等平台上使用。 </p>

<p>OpenVanilla的輕量設計，簡化了輸入法的開發工作。同時OpenVanilla也關心輸入法的各種可能性，例如更好的使用者介面設計，以及如何讓輸入法也能使用於其他語言。</p>
 title : The openvchat Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>基于FLEX、RED5的视频聊天系统 </p>

 summary : <p>DescriptionThe OpenVPN Auth-LDAP Plugin implements username/password authentication via LDAP for OpenVPN 2.x. </p>

<p>FeaturesUser authentication against LDAP. Simple Apache-style configuration file. LDAP group-based access restrictions. Integration with the OpenBSD packet filter, supporting adding and removing VPN clients from PF tables based on group membership. Tested against OpenLDAP, the plugin will authenticate against any LDAP server that supports LDAP simple binds -- including Active Directory. BuildingRequirementsOpenLDAP Headers and Library GNU Objective-C Compiler OpenVPN Plugin Header (included with the OpenVPN sources) re2c (used for the configuration file lexer) To build, you will need to configure the sources appropriately. Example: </p>

<p>./configure --prefix=/usr/local --with-openldap=/usr/local --with-openvpn=/usr/ports/security/openvpn/work/openvpn-2.0.2The module will be build in src/openvpn-auth-ldap.so and installed as ${prefix}/lib/openvpn-auth-ldap.so. </p>

<p>UsageAdd the following to your OpenVPN configuration file (adjusting the plugin path as required): </p>

<p>plugin /usr/local/lib/openvpn-auth-ldap.so &quot;&quot;The config directive must point to an auth-ldap configuration file. An example configuration file is provided with the distribution, or see the Configuration page. </p>

<p>SecurityPlease report all security issues directly to landonf+security (at) bikemonkey (dot) org. </p>

<p>Through the use of extensive unit testing, valgrind, and regression testing, we are very confident in the overall code quality of the plugin. There has been one security vulnerability to date, due to misinterpretation of LDAP RFCs. </p>

<p>2006-12-02: OpenVPN Auth-LDAP would accept empty passwords when validating against Novell Directory Server. This is known to not affect default installs of OpenLDAP (our test platform). Strict implementation of the LDAP RFCs requires that a directory server treat a bind with a valid DN and an empty password as an &quot;anonymous&quot; bind. If anonymous binds are enabled, this could lead to password bypass.</p>

 title : The optimal Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>In my geophysical work, I rely heavily upon a
<br/>generalized inversion algorithm called
<br/>Gauss-Newton optimization.  The Gauss-Newton
<br/>method minimizes objective functions that can
<br/>be iteratively approximated by quadratics.
<br/>This approach is particularly appropriate for
<br/>least-squares inversions of moderately
<br/>non-linear transforms.  The package also
<br/>contains code for conjugate-gradient and
<br/>line-search optimizations.</p>

<p>Over two decades I have implemented this
<br/>package four times, in four different
<br/>programming languages.  Every feature of this
<br/>package has been motivated by practical
<br/>application.  This particular Java version is
<br/>only a few years old, but I have already used
<br/>it for a dozen or more distinct inversion
<br/>problems.  I find no preexisting package so
<br/>suitable for typical geo</p>

 summary : <p>Download and InstallFor most people: </p>

<p>gem install optimus-epwill do the trick. </p>

<p>OverviewE-Prime is a software package used in behavioral psychology and functional neuroscience studies, with facilities for presenting stimuli and recording responses and their timing. </p>

<p>Optimus is a set of utilities to convert and process E-Prime&#39;s data files so they can be processed outside of Windows -- for example, automatically in a script. </p>

<p>This lacks a GUI, but it should now have enough features to process most E-Prime files into formats that will be useful for running GLMs and other regression tasks. </p>

<p>Most notably, this now handles: </p>

<p>Converting E-Prime files from log format into tab-delimited format Merging multiple files into one Doing columnwise mathematical operations and row-wise filtering Generating AFNI stim_times files from E-Prime data Extracting column values into tab-delimited files Version 0.6.9 releasedNew features: </p>

<p>No longer jumbles column order of eprime log files Now supports Procs for starting values of computed columns</p>

 title : The orangutan Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Orangutan Blogging EngineThis is a blogging system written in Ruby on Rails and assumes a technically savvy Rails user. Sorry, this isn&#39;t a replacement for Wordpress. I figure if you want to do a blogging system in Rails it&#39;s because you&#39;re using the framework already. So much of the configuration of this assumes you&#39;re handy with rake and YML files and the like. </p>

<p>The blogging system is intended to rely on mashing up a bunch of content from various sites instead of doing a lot of things by itself. Not only is this due to my own personal laziness but also it&#39;s due to my desire to use the best of breed of the various applications. </p>

<p>Features supported in this first beta release (which I&#39;m numbering 080325): </p>

<p>Standard blogging features (comments, posts, etc) RSS (Atom) feeds for posts Flickr support Twitter support Disqus support Google Analytics support Tagging for posts and searches and indexes by date and tags Views are done using HAML for easy modification Internal comment system with email notification of new posts, Gravatar support and more Flexible architecture allowing for new custom functionality to be easily added Administration user interface I wrote this for personal use because I didn&#39;t like the way Typo and Mephisto worked internally and wanted something of my own to hack around with. I&#39;m releasing this under the MIT license in hope that someone else may find this useful. </p>

<p>Please let me know if you have any issues or would like to contribute code. </p>

<p>Gersham Meharg, March 25th, 2008</p>

 title : The orderup Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is a Two-part Application.
<br/>The first is the Seller(restaurant owner) Side:
<br/>He has a user name and password along with his very own database.
<br/>He logs in and can view his menu items.
<br/>He can obviously add items, remove items, price items, order them how he wants, so on.
<br/>The food items can contain images and descriptions.
<br/>Complete customization.
<br/>He can add a layout for his &quot;page&quot; in the application.
<br/>There is a built in inbox that automatically grabs latest orders that have been placed.</p>

<p>The User Side:
<br/>A person can login to the app. He gets his very own database, also.
<br/>He can choose from a list of restaurants from surrounding areas.
<br/>Once chosen, the store layout that the restaurant manager has selected will be pulled up.
<br/>The menu items will be brought up, along with prices, descriptions, and images.
<br/>He can select what food he wants to eat. Drinks can be checked also, along with add-ons.
<br/>Finally there will be a checkout where the user can pay with a credit card. Once finalized, a message will be sent to the manager announcing that there is a new order he needs to get. The order will describe the final price, the entire order, the date/time it was placed, the users phone number and address.</p>

 title : The orogeny Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>So you&#39;ve used Ant, played with JRake, thought Schmant was cool and couldn&#39;t face using make again... </p>

<p>Why does building Java code have to be so hard? Wouldn&#39;t it be easier if you could write in Java to build it? And why can&#39;t it be simpler to debug build scripts and files? </p>

<p>Well, now you can. Enter orogeny! It&#39;s free, open source and has the collective wisdom of tens of man years of software development behind it. </p>

<p>Orogeny is just a build tool. Like all the best software, it&#39;s very singularly focused. It does things one way, with the principal of least surprise. It&#39;s designed to compile java into an useful output - executable, modern jars ready to just execute and go. </p>

<p>It doesn&#39;t care about your source control system, it doesn&#39;t force you to use dependency libraries like maven and it does make the simplest tool around. You can extend it - you write Java. You can have IntelliJ intellisense it!</p>

 title : The osflash-xray Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Xray (The AdminTool) is a “snapshot viewer” of the current state of your Flash application without impacting the performance or the file size of your application. Xray’s true nature is to look into the very guts of the Flash application and disolve the 2d myth you see on screen to a 3D tangible entity you can truly crawl through. </p>

<p>Note: “object” in this list might mean a literal Object, textField, class, button, sound object, video object etc) 
<br/>View physical parent/child relationships of all your objects/movieclips in the treeview View all properties/methods associated with an object/movieclip Drill down through any objects/movieclips/arrays in the Datagrid Execute actionscript at runtime. Call any of your methods from the interface at runtime! Control at runtime: o MovieClips - Edit all properties, including: Rotate, scale, move, opacity, properties, play, gotoAndPlay/Stop/labelName 
<br/>o TextFields - same as movieclips, as well as edit text, HTML text 
<br/>o Buttons - same as movieclips 
<br/>o video objects (NetStream) - play, pause, stop, view properties in realtime as video plays 
<br/>o Sound objects - play, stop, set loops, view ID3 information, all sound properties. 
<br/>Use the global.tt() to send any object/property to the output panel. Xray.trace() will recurse any object/array and display in the output panel a tabbed relational view of the object/array. Use the search tool to search the output returned. History info - use property settings saved in the history in your FLA or to reset your application to a specific state Filters Panel - use Flash8 filters at run time and copy/paste the code for use in your FLA</p>

 title : Page Not Found - Open Hub
 title : The osid-flickr Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project is a Repository OSID Provider implementation for the photo sharing site, Flickr.  The Flickr OSID can be used to perform Keyword searches against flickr and return the results as OSID Assets.  This can be used by any application which acts as an OSID consumer.  More information on OSIDs is listed below.  This OSID was originally developed by the VUE project team. </p>

<p>The Repository Open Service Interface Definition (OSID) is an O.K.I. specification which defines the storing and retrieving of digital content, referred to as Assets. OSIDs are programmatic interfaces which comprise a Service Oriented Architecture for designing and building reusable and interoperable software. Multiple repositories can be managed or searched through the use of OSID adapter patterns where underneath a single Repository OSID can exist multiple Repository OSIDs forming a federation of repositories, where each implementation may be using a distinct incompatible technology and the OSID integrates them.  For more information visit http://www.okiproject.org.  To see a good demonstration of an OSID consumer in use see http://vue.tufts.edu</p>

 summary : <p>EDLT 基于开源软件的内部项目，使用Google Hosting作为开发环境。, </p>
 summary : <p>oSpy is a tool which aids in reverse-engineering software running on the Windows platform. With the amount of proprietary systems that exist today (synchronization protocols, instant messaging, etc.), the amount of work required to keep up when developing interoperable solutions will quickly become a big burden when limited to traditional techniques. However, when the sniffing is done on the API level it allows a much more fine-grained view of what&#39;s going on. Seeing return-addresses for each recv/send call (for example), can prove useful when you want to look at the processing code at that spot in a debugger or static analysis tool. And if an application uses encrypted communication it&#39;s easy to intercept these calls as well. oSpy already intercepts one such API, and is the API used by MS</p>

<p>The OttoMate Actions serve as an engine for Apple&#39;s best-of-breed web browser, Safari -- running your web application through its paces by commanding Safari to visit your site, click links and buttons, fill out and submit web forms, and assert the existence of success pages, titles, text or HTML source code.  title : Page Not Found - Open Hub
 title : The outsider Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Table top gaming typically features turn-based combat systems that oftentimes include strict rules regarding movement and positioning of characters.  Paper maps and white board drawings have historically worked well for this purpose, and have been used for years.    </p>

<p>In a distributed game, physical paper and whiteboard markers are notably difficult to perceive from miles away. The goal of this project is to help alleviate this challenge by providing a method to replicate the ease and speed of drawing on a piece of paper in an environment that can be perceived at such distances. In lieu of major advances in virtual reality or telepathy, and at a much cheaper cost than expensive telepresence solutions used in surgeries, a networked client/server tool can provide such  an environment. </p>

<p>The plan is to provide the following features: </p>

<p>Live mapping with an accessible and fast toolset so that a game referee can create a scene on the spot.  Enjoyable, flexible graphical representations of environments and characters, featuring at least one additional dimension of representation over the two dimensional world of paper maps. Informative data tracking for characters, viewable in varying levels of detail using tooltips and inspectors, and allowing dynamic changes to reflect events in the game world. Permissions structures and rules that provide one or more individuals with special power to approve or mandate actions, and impose or override rules that govern the characters within the game. Flexible underlying systems enabling the representation of different game systems based on configurable settings and rules. Device connectivity to enable multiple distributed devices to view the same scene, receive timely updates, and provide their own input to the world. voice communication facilities to enable remote users to join in real time conversations with the other players. tools and enhancements to make the use of the tool seamless and unobtrusive.</p>

 title : The owasp-esapi-java Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>OWASP ESAPI for Java: Strong, Simple Security Controls for Java Developers  </p>

<p>Don’t write your own security controls! Reinventing the wheel when it comes to developing security controls for every web application or web service leads to wasted time and massive security holes. The OWASP Enterprise Security API (ESAPI) Toolkits help software developers guard against security‐related design and implementation flaws. </p>

<p>For more information, please visit our Wiki.  </p>

<p>You can view the latest version of our Javadocs here.  </p>

<p>You can see the status of what we are working on for the next release here. </p>

<p>Other language versions:  </p>

<p> PHP .NET Python Classic ASP Cold Fusion Haskell</p>
 summary : <p>Welcome to the distribution repository for the OWASP AntiSamy project (http://www.owasp.org/index.php/AntiSamy) is a collection of APIs for safely allowing users to supply their own HTML and CSS without exposing the site to XSS vulnerabilities. </p>

<p>The methodology of AntiSamy is unique in that it is built on a positive security model in both the format of the HTML document and the content within the document. It&#39;s also unique in that it attempts to help the user tune their input to pass validation in a cooperative spirit, rather than treating users as potential attackers which is how all contemporary security mechanisms work. </p>

<p>-Arshan Dabirsiaghi</p>

 title : The owl1-1 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is the primary workspace of the OWLED series of workshops. </p>

<p>This project contains the first major output of OWLED: the specification of OWL 1.1. OWL 1.1 was submitted to the W3C and now serves as the major input to the OWL working group. Accordinging, all unresolved issues have been migrated to the OWL WG tracker. Discussion is still taking place on the W3C mailing list, public-owl-dev (see the archives). Bug reports about OWL 1.1 should be directed to the OWL Working Group. </p>

<p>The issues list can be used to register issues against various task forces.</p>

 title : The p2-php-framework Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The p2p-videolan Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>BETA-0.01 Abstract </p>

<p>Run VideoLAN in a P2P fashion. The primary goal of this idea is to encourage two or more VideoLAN users on overlay networks to contribute in &#39;Synergy&#39; network, an integration of RON, Resilient Overlay Network. By applying incentive mechanisms, co-existing overlay networks would gain benefit and fairness if they choose to cooperate.(Better video quality!) The measure of success is evaluated by an utility function, which captures the ideas of bandwidth and congestion.  </p>

<p>The vision of this project is to enable each VLC peer having a quality stream of 300Kbps or more. We would like to make P2P VideoLAN resilient by experimenting the system in a small scale around 50 nodes. Therefore the P2P VideoLAN can provide good video quality and detect network failures quickly. Other students should be genuinely interested in this idea for the future work. Like other successful P2P file sharing applications, P2P VideoLAN has great potential to reach a critical mass of users. </p>

<p>Summary   </p>

<p>Taxation and Bit-for-Bit are incentive mechanisms for p2p network. It is possible to apply similar mechanisms to inter-overlay networks as well. In this project, we will extend incentive methods to Synergy, an inter-overlay architecture constructed by RON, Resilient Overlay Network. 
<br/>   For example, the primary agent in Synergy will try to maximize the sum of overall utilities. The primary agent can achieve this by controlling traffic in Synergy or limiting flow in each overlay. Overlays now are more willing to contribute, since contribution in this incentive game will increase its utility in general. 
<br/>  Therefore, the core problem of this project is to explore possible good incentives mechanisms that would encourage overlays to contribute. We would also like to come up a better design and implementation which would improve Synergy. The experiment will be run on PlanetLab, and utility gains among different incentive methods will be the measure of success. 
<br/>  1 Background Overlay networks provides an infrastructure which is flexible and easily deployable. Synergy, an overlay inter-networking architecture, further leverages the use of each individual overlay. Better routes and richer resources might present in Synergy network that a single overlay might not have. 
<br/>  2 Overview Architecture 
<br/>  2.1 RON 
<br/>Resilient Overlay Network (RON) is to provide a routing overlay that can quickly detect and recover from failures. To achieve this goal, each node in RON network will constantly probe every other nodes to exchange routing information, such as packet loss rate and latency(RTT). Each node then computes bandwidth on each link and stores the information in its performance database. Since each node now has global knowledge of a complete graph in RON, they can arbitrarily pick their desired route and quickly route around various Internet failures. 
<br/>  2.2 Synergy 
<br/>The goal of Synergy is to cooperate co-existing overlays. Each individual overlay under Synergy is a module of RON. A Synergy network is formed by a collection of exported nodes from each overlay under Synergy. Since Synergy is a larger set of RON network, it has potential to provide richer resources and better routes that a single overlay might not have. 
<br/>    3 Methods 
<br/>We would like to see which of the following methods yields the highest overall utilities in Synergy network. The utilities function is defined as follow: 
<br/>  ui(ri, fi, Fi) = bi(ri) – ci(fi, Fi) 
<br/>Fi: forward capacity 
<br/>Ri: receive capacity 
<br/>fi, ri: actual forward bandwidth and actual receive bandwidth 
<br/>bi: capture the idea of benefit 
<br/>ci: capture the idea of cost with fi, Fi, and congestion 
<br/>  With the utilities function, we can evaluate the following three incentive methods and analyze the results. 
<br/>  3.1 Bit-for-Bit Method 
<br/>There is no free lunch. Under Bit-for-Bit scheme, how much a peer can download is equal to how much a peer are willing to upload. The utility gain is propositional to the upload rate. This method is simple and fair. It is expected to perform well under the situation that every host in the overlay networks has high bandwidth. 
<br/>  3.2 BitTorrent Methods 
<br/>BitTorrent, like Gnutella and Napster, are popular file sharing software. Its built-in incentive mechanism is a process of peer selection. A peer would upload to other peers which contribute the most packets to it. Meanwhile the peer might drop one of the currently connected peers if there is another peer that contributes more. For example, peer P is uploading and downloading from four peers. Every 30 seconds, peer P will upload to a new peer in the network and download from that new peer as well. If the new peer contributes more packets to P than any of the original four peers that P connects, P will drop the peer which contributes the least and pick the new peer to exchange file. 
<br/>  3.3 Taxation Methods 
<br/>The goal of Taxation scheme is to yield the highest &#39;overall&#39; utility. Each peer in overlay will determine its upload rate and download rate based on a fixed tax schedule. Peers can also strategically change their upload rate to maximize its utility function. The equation for a tax schedule can be linear or exponential. A linear tax schedule looks like this 
<br/>f = max(t . (r-G),0) 
<br/>f: forward rate(upload rate) 
<br/>t: tax, which is constant 
<br/>r: receive rate(download rate) 
<br/>G: grant, or surplus bandwidth 
<br/>  As long as the tax rate t is greater than one, there is a chance that f &gt; r, and the difference between f and r will go into G. Therefore the primary agent in Synergy can redistribute the extra bandwidth by increasing G in the tax schedule. It results in re-distribution of bandwidth among peers. Notice that this tax schedule is not to maximize each peer&#39;s utility function, but to maximize the overall utilities in Synergy network. This scheme seems to be the best incentive method because it supports the notion of “try your best to contribute, and it is very likely you get higher download bandwidth.” On the other hand, under Bit-to-Bit and BitTorrent&#39;s incentive methods, peers&#39; utility gain is strictly limited to their actual upload capacity. 
<br/>      4 Deliverables 
<br/>  Final Report 
<br/>Summary of Related Work 
<br/>Explanation of Incentive Algorithms 
<br/>Synergy Design 
<br/>Experimental Results 
<br/>Analysis of Experimental Results 
<br/>Summary of work 
<br/>Future Work 
<br/>  C++ Code 
<br/>Front-end Application 
<br/>Graphical User Interface 
<br/>  C++ Executable 
<br/>Binary code on UNIX/Linux machine </p>

<p>References </p>

<p>Minseok Kwon, Sonia Fahmy, Synergy: An Overlay Internetworking Architecture and its Implementation </p>

<p>David G. Andersen, Hari Balakrishnan, M. Frans Kaashoek, Robert Morris, David G. Andersen, Hari Balakrishnan, M. Frans Kaashoek, Robert Morris Proc. 18th ACM SOSP, Banff, Canada, October 2001.   	 </p>

<p>Yang-hua Chu, John Chuang,Hui Zhang, A case for taxation in peer-to-peer streaming broadcast</p>

 title : The p9authlinux Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The project contains the code for the components needed to use Plan 9 authentication in Linux. Currently it includes the Plan 9 capability device implemented as a character device driver for the Linux kernel and the user space PAM module. </p>

 summary : <p>Hi guys, my name is PacBuilder! </p>

<p> </p>

<p>PacBuilder is a simple utility which gives the users the ability to compile/recompile archlinux packages, fetching their PKGBUILDs from both ABS and AUR. This software could be considered similar to gentoo&#39;s &quot;emerge&quot;. </p>

<p>It is written from scratch with a simple but organized code, and supports translations (using gettext) too! </p>

<p>It differs from other tools like yaourt because it has few features like recompiling the whole system and/or build the dependencies of a package (while yaourt simply installs the binary). </p>

<p>Everything is provided with a nice text-based interface.</p>

 title : The packetfu Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>PacketFu is a mid-level, cross-platform packet manipulation library for Ruby, allowing for easy Layer 4 and below packet creation and parsing.</p>

 summary : <p>THIS IS OLD AND PROBABLY SHOULDN&#39;T BE USED. IN FACT IF YOU ARE LOOKING TO PROXY RUBY SHIT:  </p>

<p>USE NGINX </p>

<p>USE NGINX </p>

<p>USE NGINX </p>

<p>Service script for the load balancer to allow multiple pen instances to be ran as a service. </p>

<p>This is a modification of Coda Hale&#39;s very useful &quot;pen-service_0.2&quot; which allows pen to be ran as a service. This version adds the ability to have multiple conf files in /etc/pen  to create multiple instances of pen. </p>

<p>Thanks Coda! - To see Coda&#39;s great original post on Pound vs. Pen, how to get things rolling with this kind of setup, and the original pen-service, visit his blog at http://blog.codahale.com/2006/11/07/pound-vs-pen-because-you-need-a-load-balancing-proxy/ </p>

<p>INSTALLATION (mostly taken from Coda&#39;s original instructions) </p>

<p>After downloading packofpens-service_0.2.tar.gz from the download section: </p>

<p>server:~$ tar -xzvf packofpens-service_0.2.tar.gz </p>

<p>server:~$ cd packofpens-service </p>

<p>server:~$ sudo mkdir /etc/pen </p>

<p>server:~$ sudo mv project1.conf /etc/pen </p>

<p>server:~$ sudo mv packofpens /etc/init.d/pen </p>

<p>server:~$ sudo chmod +x /etc/init.d/pen </p>

<p>server:~$ sudo update-rc.d pen defaults </p>

<p>This last command is distribution specific, you may have to use a different way of entering packofpens into your rc.d . </p>

<p>After this, edit your conf files in /etc/pen to suit your needs!</p>
